head: Appendix: List of Verbs
p: THIS List in general includes the common verbs showing any formal peculiarity of tense. The forms printed in heavy-faced type belong to standard Attic, that is, to the language used in common speech and in ordinary prose; others are poetical, doubtful, dialectal or late. Many regular forms are omitted because they do not appear in the classical writers; though their non-appearance in the extant texts may often be accidental. Later forms are usually excluded, but reference is made to Aristotle, and to Hippocrates, though many works ascribed to him are of later date. The determination of the forms of Attic prose as distinguished from those of poetry is often difficult because of insufficient evidence, and in many cases certainty is not to be attained. The tenses employed in the dialogue parts of Aristophanes and other early writers of Attic comedy are usually to be regarded as existing in the spoken language except when the character of the verb in question is such as to indicate borrowing from Epic or tragedy. Sometimes a tense attested only in tragedy and in Attic prose of the latter part of the fourth century may have been used in the best Attic prose. The expression in prose means in Attic prose.

A prefixed hyphen indicates that a form used in prose is attested generally, or only, in composition; and that a poetical form occurs only in composition. Rigid consistency would have led to too great detail; besides, many tenses cited as existing only in composition may have occurred also in the simple form. For the details of usage on this and other points the student is referred to Veitch, Greek Verbs, Irregular and Defective, and to Kühner-Blass, Griechische Grammatik.

The tenses cited are those of the principal parts (369). Tenses inferred from these are omitted, but mention is made of the future perfect, future passive, and of the future middle when it shows a passive sense.

An assumed form is marked by * or has no accent; the abbreviations aor. and perf. denote first aorist and first perfect; of alternative forms in tt or ss (78), that in tt is given when the verb in question belongs to the classical spoken language. In the citation of Epic forms, futures and aorists with ss, and several other Epic peculiarities, are usually not mentioned.
The appended Roman numerals indicate the class (497-529) to which the present system of each verb belongs; all verbs not so designated belong to the first class (498-504).
At the end of an item, "LSJ" marks a link to the verb's definition in the Greek-English Lexicon.

div2.head: Verbs beginning with a
div2.p: *a)a/w (a)va-w), a)a/zw harm, infatuate: pres. only in mid. a)a=tai; aor. a_)/asa (a_)/a_sa or a_)/assa), a)=sa, a_)asa/mhn (and a)a_sa/mhn or a)assa/mhn) erred; aor. pass. a)a/sqhn; v. a. in a)-a_/atos, a)-a_/a_tos, a)/n-a_tos. Chiefly Epic. LSJ
a)ga/llw (a)gal-) adorn, honour (act. in Com. poets): a)galw=, h)/ghla; mid. a)ga/llomai glory in, only pres. and imperf. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

a)/ga-mai admire (725): aor. h)ga/sqhn (489 e), rarely h)gasa/mhn, v. a. a)gasto/s. Epic fut. a)ga/s(s)omai, Epic aor. h)gas(s)a/mhn. Hom. has also a)ga/omai admire and a)gai/omai (a)ga- for a)gas-) envy, am indignant at or with. (Attic) LSJ
a)gge/llw (a)ggel-) announce: a)ggelw=, h)/ggeila, h)/ggelka, h)/ggelmai, h)gge/lqhn, a)ggelqh/somai, a)ggelto/s. 2 aor. pass. h)gge/lhn rarely on Att. inscr. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

a)gei/rw (a)ger-) collect: h)/geira. Epic are aor. mid. cun-hgeira/mhn; 2 aor. mid. a)ge/ronto assembled, h)/greto (MSS. e)/greto), a)gere/sqai, 425 a, D. (some read with MSS. a)ge/resqai), a)gro/menos; plup. 3 pl. a)ghge/rato; aor. pass. h)ge/rqhn. Epic by-form h)gere/qomai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
a)gi_ne/w Epic and Ion. = a)/gw. Inf. a)gi_ne/menai Epic. (Attic) LSJ
a)gnoe/w not to know: regular, but a)gnoh/somai as pass. (808). Hom. a)gnoie/w. (Attic) LSJ

a)/g-nu_mi (a)g- for vag-, 733) break, in prose generally kata_/gnu_mi, kata_gnu/w in all
tenses: -a/cw, -e/a_ca (431), 2 perf. -e/a_ga (443), 2 aor. pass. -ea_/ghn (434). -akto/s. Epic aor. h)=ca, and 2 aor. pass. e)a^/ghn and a^)/ghn; Ion. 2 perf. e)/hga. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

a)/gw lead: a)/cw, 2 aor. h)/gagon, h)=xa, h)=gmai, h)/xqhn, a)xqh/somai, a)kte/os. Fut. mid. a)/comai, also = fut. pass. (809). Aor. h)=ca suspected in Att., Hom. a)ca/mhn: Hom. has mixed aor. a)/cete, a)ce/menai, a)ce/men (542 D.). (Attic) LSJ
a_)de- or a_(de- be sated in Epic aor. opt. a_)dh/seien and perf. a_)dhko/tes. LSJ
a)/|dw sing: a)/|somai (806), h)=|sa, h)=|smai, h)/|sqhn, a)|ste/os. Uncontracted forms in Epic and Ion. are a)ei/dw, a)ei/sw and a)ei/somai, h)/eisa. (Attic) LSJ
a)e- rest, sleep: Epic aor. a)/esa, a)=sa. LSJ
a)ei/rw: see ai)/rw. (Attic) LSJ
a)e/cw: Hom. for au)/cw (au)ca/nw). (Attic) LSJ

a)/hmi (a)h-, a)e-, 724, 741) blow: 3 s. a)/hsi, 3 du. a)/hton, 3 pl. a)ei=si, inf. a)h/menai, a)h=nai, part. a)ei/s, imperf. 3 s. a)/h; mid. pres. a)/htai, part. a)h/menos, imperf. a)/hto. Poetic, chiefly Epic. LSJ

ai)de/omai (ai)de- for ai)des-) respect, feel shame: ai)de/somai (488 a), h)/|desmai (489 c), h)|de/sqhn, ai)desqh/somai rare (812), h)|desa/mhn pardon a criminal in prose, otherwise Tragic. Imper. ai)dei=o Hom. (650). Poetic ai)/domai. (Attic) LSJ
ai)ki/zomai outrage: ai)kiou=mai, h)|kisa/mhn, h)/|kismai, h)|ki/sqhn was outraged. ai)ki/zw act. plague poetic. Epic a)eiki/zw. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

ai)ne/w praise, usu. comp. w. e)pi/, para/, etc., in prose: -aine/sw (in prose usu. -aine/somai, 488 b, 806), -h/|nesa, -h/|neka, -h/|nhmai, -h|ne/qhn, -ainesqh/somai, -ainete/os, -to/s Aristotle. Epic and Lyric are ai)nh/sw, h)/|nhsa. (Attic) LSJ
ai)/-numai take: only pres. and imperf. (ai)nu/mhn). Epic. (IV.) LSJ

ai(re/w (ai(re-, e(l-) take, mid. choose: ai(rh/sw, 2 aor. ei(=lon (431), h(/|rhka, h(/|rhmai (mid. or pass.), h(|re/qhn (usu. was chosen), ai(reqh/somai, ai(reto/s, -te/os. Fut. perf. h(|rh/somai rare. Hdt. perf. a)rai/rhka, a)rai/rhmai; Hom. v. a. e(leto/s. (VI.) (Attic) LSJ

ai)/rw (544 c) raise: a_)rw=, h)=ra (a_)/rw, a_)/raimi, a)=ron, a)=rai, a_)/ra_s), h)=rka, h)=rmai, h)/rqhn, a_)rqh/somai, a_)rte/os. Ionic and poetic a)ei/rw (a)ver-): a)erw=, h)/eira, h)e/rqhn, Hom. plup. a)/wrto (from h)orto) for h)/erto. Fut. a)rou=mai and aor. h)ro/mhn belong to a)/rnumai (a)r-) win. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ai)sq-a/nomai (ai)sq-, ai)sqe-) perceive: ai)sqh/somai, 2 aor. h)|sqo/mhn, h)/|sqhmai, ai)sqhto/s. The by-form ai)/sqomai is doubtful. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
a)i+/ssw rush: see a)/|ttw. (Attic) LSJ

ai)sx-u_/nw (ai)sxun-) disgrace, mid. feel ashamed: ai)sxunw=, h)/|sxu_na, h)|sxu/nqhn felt ashamed, ai)sxunte/os. On fut. mid. ai)sxunou=mai and fut. pass. ai)sxunqh/somai, see 1911. Hom. perf. pass. part. h)|sxumme/nos. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

a)i+/w hear, with a_ usu. in Att. poets, a^ in Epic, Lyric, and in some Att. poets: imperf. Hom. h)/i+on, a)/i+on and a_)/i+on, aor. e)p-h=|se Hdt. (MSS. e)ph=ise), v. a. e)pa/i+stos Hdt. Poetic and Ion. Hom. has also a)ei/w, of which a)i+w/n (MSS. a)i+/wn) may be the 2 aor. LSJ
a)i+/w breathe out: imperf. a_)/i+on Epic. LSJ

a)k-ax-i/zw (a)kaxid-, a)kax-, a)kaxe-, from a)x- redupl.) afflict, grieve: a)kaxh/sw, a)ka/xhsa (rare), 2 aor. h)/kaxon, a)ka/xhmai am grieved (3 pl. a)khxe/datai), inf. a)ka/xhsqai (425 a, D.), part. a)kaxh/menos and a)khxe/menos (425 b, (2) D.) Cp. a)xe/w, a)xeu/w, a)/xnumai. Epic. 512. (III.) LSJ

a)k-ax-me/nos (a)k-; cp. a)/k-ron peak) sharpened; Epic redupl. perf. part., with no present in use.
LSJ
a)ke/omai (a)ke- for a)kes-; cp. to\ a)/kos cure) heal: h)kesa/mhn, a)kesto/s. Hom. has also a)kei/w. (Attic) LSJ
a)khde/w (a)khde- for a)khdes-, 488 D.; cp. a)khdh/s uncared for) neglect: a)kh/desa Epic. Epic and poetic. LSJ
a)kou/w (a)kou-, a)ko&uglide;-, 43) hear: a)kou/somai (806), h)/kousa, 2 perf. a)kh/koa (562 a), 2 plup. h)khko/h or a)khko/h, h)kou/sqhn (489 e), a)kousqh/somai, a)kousto/s, -te/os. (Attic) LSJ
a)lala/zw (a)lalag-) raise the war-cry, usu. poetic or late prose: a)lala/comai (806), h)la/laca. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
a)la/omai wander, rare in prose: pres. Epic imper. a)la/ou (MSS. a)lo/w, 643), perf. Epic a)la/lhmai as pres. (a)la/lhso, a)la/lhsqai, a)lalh/menos), aor. Epic a)lh/qhn. (Attic) LSJ
a)lapa/zw (a)lapag-) destroy, plunder: Epic are a)lapa/cw, a)la/paca. By-forms lapa/zw, lapa/ssw. (III.) LSJ
a)ldai/nw (a)ldan-) with the by-forms a)lda/nw, a)ldh/skw, nourish: Epic 2 aor. (or imperf.) h)/ldanon, v. a. Epic a)/n-altos insatiate. Poetic. (IV.) LSJ
a)lei/fw (a)leif-, a)lif-) anoint: a)lei/yw, h)/leiya, a)p-alh/lifa (477 a), a)lh/limmai, h)lei/fqhn, a)leifqh/somai, e)c-aleipte/os. 2 aor. pass. h)li/fhn, h)lei/fhn are doubtful. (Attic) LSJ

a)le/cw and a)le/kw (a)lec-, a)lece-, a)lek-, a)lk-) ward off: fut. a)le/cw poetic (rare), a)le/comai Xen., Soph., a)lech/sw Hom., a)lech/somai Hdt.; aor. h)/leca Aesch., h)le/chsa Epic, h)leca/mhn Ion., Xen., h)lechsa/mhn (?) Xen., 2 aor. a)/lalkon poetic (549). By-form a)lka/qw poetic (490 D.). LSJ
a)le/omai avoid: aor. h)lea/mhn (43, 607). Cp. a)leu/w. Poetic. LSJ

a)leu/w avert: h)/leusa. Usu. in mid. a)leu/omai avoid, aor. h)leua/mhn, subj. e)c-aleu/-swmai (e)c-alu/cwmai?). Poetic. Other forms with like meaning are a)leei/nw, a)lu/skw, a)luska/zw, a)luskai/nw. LSJ
a)le/w grind: a)lw= (539), h)/lesa, a)lh/lemai (a)lh/lesmai, 489 b). By-form a)lh/qw. (Attic) LSJ
a)lh=nai: see ei)/lw. LSJ
a)/lqomai (a)lq-, a)lqe-) am healed: Epic a)/lqeto and e)p-alqh/somai. Hippocr. has aor. -hlqe/sqhn. LSJ
a)li/ndw cause to roll (also a)linde/w, a)li_(w), usu. comp. with e)c: -h/li_sa, -h/li_ka, h)li/ndhmai. a)li_/w is a pres. derived from h)/li_sa ( = h)lindsa). (Attic) LSJ

a(l-i/skomai (a(l- for val-, a(lo-, 486) am captured (used as pass. of ai(rw=): a(lw/somai, 2 aor. e(a_/lwn or h(/lwn (a(lw=, a(loi/hn, a(lw=nai, a(lou/s, 687), e(a/lwka (443) or h(/lwka, a(lwto/s. Epic 2 aor. subj. a(lw/w. Act. a(li/skw is not used, but see a)na_li/skw expend. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
a)litai/nomai (a)lit-, a)litan-) sin: Epic are aor. h)/liton (-o/mhn), perf. part. a)lith/menos sinning. Mostly Epic. Epic by-form a)litrai/nw. (III. IV.) LSJ

a)lla/ttw (a)llag-) change, often comp. W. a)po/, dia/, meta/: a)lla/cw, h)/llaca, -h/llaxa, h)/llagmai, h)lla/xqhn (usu. in tragedy) and h)lla/ghn (both usu. in comp.), fut. pass. a)p-allaxqh/somai (so in tragedy) and a)p-allagh/somai, fut. mid. -alla/comai, fut. perf. a)p-hlla/comai, v. a. a)p-allakte/os. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
a(/llomai (a(l-) leap: a(lou=mai, h(la/mhn. 2 aor. h(lo/mhn rare and uncertain in Att. Epic 2 aor. a)=lso, a)=lto, a)/lmenos (688). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
a)lukta/zw am distressed Ion., a)lukte/w am anxious late Ion.: Epic a)lalu/kthmai W. reduplication. 512. (III.) LSJ
a)lu/skw (a)luk-, 526 d) avoid: a)lu/cw, h)/luca. Hom. has also a)luska/zw and a)luska/nw. Poetic. (V.) LSJ

a)lf-a/nw (a)lf-) find, acquire: Epic 2 aor. h)=lfon. (IV.)
LSJ

a(mart-a/nw (a(mart-, a(marte-) err: a(marth/somai (806), 2 aor. h(/marton, h(ma/rthka, h(ma/rthmai, h(marth/qhn, a)n-ama/rthtos, e)pec-amarthte/os. Epic 2 aor. h)/mbroton (for b, see 130). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
a(mbl-i/skw (a)mbl-) and a)mblo/w miscarry; reg. in comp. W. e)c: -h/mblwsa, -h/mblwka, -h/mblwmai. Other forms are late. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

a)mei/bw change, rare in Att. prose: a)mei/yw, h)/meiya. Mid. a)mei/bomai make return, rare in prose and comedy: a)mei/yomai, h)meiya/mhn. In the meaning answer h)meiya/mhn and h)mei/fqhn are poetic. (Attic) LSJ
a)mei/rw (a)mer-) deprive, only in pres. Poetic. (III.) LSJ
a)me/rdw deprive: h)/mersa, h)me/rqhn. Poetic. LSJ

a)mp-e/xw and rare a)mp-i/sxw (a)mfi/ + e)/xw, 125 d) put about, clothe: imperf. a)mpei=xon (Hom. a)mp-e/xon), a)mf-e/cw, 2 aor. h)/mp-isxon. Mid. a)mp-e/xomai (a)mp-i/sxomai and a)mf-iskne/omai) wear: imperf. h)mp-eixo/mhn (451), fut. a)mf-e/comai, 2 aor. h)mp-esxo/mhn and h)mp-isxo/mhn. See e)/xw and i)/sxw. (Attic) LSJ
a)mplak-i/skw (a)mplak-, a)mplake-) err, miss: 2 aor. h)/mplakon and h)/mblakon (part. a)mplakw/n and a^)plakw/n), h)mpla/khmai, a)n-ampla/khtos. Poetic. (V.) LSJ
a)/mpnue, a)mpnu/nqhn, a)/mpnu_to (Epic): see pne/w. (Attic) LSJ
a)mu_/nw (a)mun-) ward off: a)munw=, h)/mu_na. Mid. a)mu_/nomai defend myself: a)munou=mai, h)mu_na/mhn, v. a. a)munte/os. By-form a)mu_na/qw, 490 D. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
a)mu/ttw (a)mux-) scratch: a)mu/cw, h)/muca. Poetic and Ion. (III.) LSJ
a)mfi-gnoe/w doubt: imperf. h)mf-egno/oun (h)mfi-gno/oun?), aor. h)mf-egno/hsa. 451. (Attic) LSJ
a)mfi-e/nnu_mi (late a)mfiennu/w) clothe: a)mfi-w= (539 c), h)mfi/-esa (450), h)mfi/-esmai. Mid. fut. a)mfi-e/somai, aor. a)mfi-esa/mhn poetic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
a)mfisbhte/w dispute: the augmented (451) h)mfesbh/toun, h)mfesbh/thsa (inscr.) are better than h)mfi- (MSS.). Fut. mid. a)mfisbhth/somai as pass. (808). (Attic) LSJ
a)nai/nomai (a)nan-) refuse, only pres. and imperf. in prose; aor. h)nana/mhn poetic. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

a)n-a_l-i/skw (a(l-, a(lo-, 486) and a)na_lo/w expend (from a)na-val-): imperf. a)nh/liskon (a)nh/loun, rare), a)na_lw/sw, a)nh/lwsa, a)nh/lwka, a)nh/lwmai, a)nhlw/qhn, fut. pass. a)na_lwqh/somai, a)na_lwte/os. Att. inscr. prove the MSS. forms a)na_/lwsa, a)na_/lwka, a)na_/lwmai, a)na_lw/qhn to be late. kat-hna_/lwsa, -hna_/lwmai, -hna_lw/qhn are also late. See a(li/skomai. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

a(nda/nw (a(d- for svad-, 123, and a(de-) usu. Epic and Ion., but the pres. occurs in Att. poetry: imperf. Hom. probably e(a/ndanon and a(/ndanon (MSS. e(h/ndanon and h(/ndanon), Hdt. h(/ndanon (some write e(a/ndanon); fut. Hdt. a(dh/sw; 2 aor. Hdt. e(/adon, Hom. eu)/adon (for e)vvadon from e)svadon) and a(/don; 2 perf. Hom. e(/a_da (443). Adj. a)/smenos pleased, in common use. Chiefly Epic and Ion. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

a)n-e/xw hold up, poetic and New Ion.: a)n-ei=xon, a)n-e/cw and a)na-sxh/sw, a)n-e/sxon. a)n-e/xomai endure: h)n-eixo/mhn (451), a)n-e/comai and a)na-sxh/somai, 2 aor. h)nesxo/mhn, a)n-ekto/s, -te/os. (Attic) LSJ
a)nh/noqe (a)neq-, a)noq-) mounts up r 270, sprang forth *l 266. a)n- is probably the prep. Cp. -enh/noqe. LSJ

a)n-oi/g-nu_mi and a)n-oi/gw open: imperf. a)n-e/w|gon (431), a)n-oi/cw, a)n-e/w|ca, 1 perf. a)n-e/w|xa, 2 perf. a)n-e/w|ga (rare, 443) have opened, a)n-e/w|gmai stand open, a)n-ew/|xqhn, fut. perf. a)n-ew/|comai, a)n-oikte/os. Cp. 808. oi)/gnu_mi and oi)/gw (q.v.) poetic. Imperf. a)nw=|gon *c 168 may be written a)ne/w|gon W. synizesis. h)/noigon and h)/noica in Xen. are probably wrong; Hom. has w)=|ca (oi)=ca?), and w)/eica (MSS. w)/i+ca) from o)ei/gw (Lesb.); Hdt. a)/noica and a)nw=|ca (MSS.). (IV.)
(Attic) LSJ
a)n-orqo/w set upright has the regular augment (a)n-w/rqwsa); but e)p-anorqo/w has double augment: e)p-hn-w/rqoun, e)p-hn-w/rqwsa, e)p-hn-w/rqwmai (451). (Attic) LSJ
a)ntibole/w meet, beseech often has two augments: h)nt-ebo/loun, h)nt-ebo/lhsa (451). (Attic) LSJ
a)ntidike/w am defendant may have double augment: h)nt-edi/koun, h)nt-edi/khsa (451). (Attic) LSJ

a(nu/w and (rarer) a(nu/tw (531) (often written a)nu/w, a)nu/tw) accomplish: a)nu/sw, h)/nusa, h(/nuka, di-h/nusmai (?) Xen., a)nusto/s, a)n-h/nu(s)tos poetic. Hom. fut. -anu/w. Poetic forms are a)/nw, a_)/nw (pres. and imperf.), and a_)/numi (h)/nuto e 243), e)p-hnu/sqhn Epic. (Attic) LSJ

a)/nwga (439 D.) Epic 2 perf. as pres. command (1 pl. a)/nwgmen, imper. a)/nwxqi, a)nw/xqw, a)/nwxqe), 2 plup. as imperf. h)nw/gea, 3 s. h)nw/gei and a)nw/gei. To a)nw/gw, a pres. developed from the perf., many forms may be referred, as pres. a)nw/gei, subj. a)nw/gw, opt. a)nw/goimi, imper. a)/nwge, inf. a)nwge/men, part. a)nw/gwn, imperf. h)/nwgon, fut. a)nw/cw, aor. h)/nwca. Poetic and Ion. LSJ
a)p-anta/w meet: a)p-anth/somai (806), a)p-h/nthsa, a)p-h/nthka, a)p-anthte/os. (Attic) LSJ
a)pata/w deceive: regular, but as fut. pass. a)path/somai and e)c-apathqh/somai (809). Cp. 454 a. (Attic) LSJ

a)p-aura/w take away, found in the imperf. a)phu/rwn (with aoristic force), fut. a)pourh/sw, aor. part. a)pou/ra_s (as if from a)pou/rhmi), a)poura/menos. The root is probably vra_, a)phu/rwn representing a)p-eurwn for a)p-evrwn (with h for e by mistake), as a)pou/ra_s represents a)po-vra_s. Poetic and Epic. LSJ
a)p-af-i/skw (a)p-af-, a)p-afe-) deceive, comp. W. e)c: -apafh/sw rare, -apa/fhsa rare, 2 aor. -h/pafon, mid. opt. -apafoi/mhn. Poetic. (V.) LSJ
a)p-exq-a/nomai (e)xq-, e)xqe-) am hated: a)p-exqh/somai, 2 aor. a)p-hxqo/mhn, a)ph/xqhmai. Simple forms are e)/xqw, e)/xqomai. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
a)po/-(v)erse swept off: a)po-e/rsh|, a)po-e/rseie. Epic. LSJ
a)po-lau/w enjoy (the simple lau/w is unused): a)po-lau/somai (806), a)p-e/lausa, a)po-le/lauka (450). (Attic) LSJ
a(/p-tw (a(f-) fasten, kindle, mid. touch: a(/yw, h(=ya, h(=mmai, h(/fqhn, a(pto/s, -te/os. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
a)ra/omai pray (Epic a_)ra/omai), often comp. W. e)pi/ or kata/: a)ra_/somai, h)ra_sa/mhn, -h/ra_mai, a)ra_to/s poetic. Epic act. inf. a_)rh/menai. Ion. a)re/omai. (Attic) LSJ

a)r-ar-i/skw (a)r-) fit, join trans.: h)=rsa, 2 aor. h)/raron trans. and intrans. (448 D.), 2 perf. a)/ra_ra intrans., aor. pass. h)/rqhn. Ion. and Epic 2 perf. a)/rhra, plup. a)rh/rea and h)rh/rea. 2 aor. part. mid. a)/rmenos, as adj., fitting. Poetic. (V.) LSJ
a)ra/ttw (a)rag-) strike, comp. in prose W. a)po/, e)c, e)pi/, kata/, su/n; -ara/cw, -h/raca, -hra/xqhn. Cp. r(a/ttw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
a)re/-skw (a)re- for a)res-; cp. to\ a)/ros help) please: a)re/sw, h)/resa; mid. a)re/skomai appease: a)re/somai, h)resa/mhn, h)re/sqhn (?), a)resto/s pleasing. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
a_/rhme/nos oppressed. Epic perf. mid. of uncertain derivation. LSJ
a)rke/w (a)rke- for a)rkes-; cp. to\ a)/rkos defence) assist, suffice: a)rke/sw, h)/rkesa. (Attic) LSJ
a)rmo/ttw and poetic a(rmo/zw (a(rmod-) fit: a(rmo/sw, h(/rmosa, h(/rmosmai, h(rmo/sqhn. Aor. suna/rmoca Pind., perf. h(/rmoka Aristotle. 516. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
a(/r-numai (a)r-) win: a)rou=mai, 2 aor. h)ro/mhn (inf. a)re/sqai). Chiefly poetic. Cp. ai)/rw. (IV.) LSJ
a)ro/w plough: aor. act. h)/rosa and aor. pass. h)ro/qhn are, in Attic, attested only in poetry; perf. mid. a)rh/romai Epic and Ion. (Attic) LSJ

a(rpa/zw (a(rpag-) seize, snatch: a(rpa/somai (806), less often a(rpa/sw, h(/rpasa,
h(/rpaka, h(/rpasmai, h(rpa/sqhn, a(rpasqh/somai. Fut. a(rpa/cw Epic, aor. h(/rpaca poetic, aor. pass. h(rpa/xqhn Hdt., v. a. a(rpakto/s Hesiod. 516. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

a)rtu_/w (Hom. a)rtu^/w) prepare: in prose often comp. W. e)c or kata/: a)rtu_/sw, h)/rtu_sa, -h/rtu_ka, -h/rtu_mai, -hrtu_/qhn. Cp. Epic a)rtu_/nw (a)rtun-): a)rtune/w, h)/rtu_na, h)rtu/qhn. (Attic) LSJ
a)/rxw begin, rule, mid. begin; a)/rcw, h)=rca, h)=rxa late, h)=rgmai mid., h)/rxqhn, a)rkte/os, fut. mid. a)/rcomai sometimes as pass. (808), a)rxqh/somai Aristotle. (Attic) LSJ
a)stra/p-tw (a)strap-) lighten, flash: a)stra/yw, h)/straya. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
a)tita/llw (a)tital-) rear, Epic and Lyric: a)ti/thla. (III.) LSJ

a)/|ttw (a)/|ssw; from vai-vik-&iglide;w) rush, rare in prose: a)/|cw, h)=|ca. From Ion. and poetic a)i+/ssw (Hom. a_)i+/ssw) come a)i+/cw, h)/i+ca (-a/mhn), h)i+/xqhn (with act. meaning). (III.) (Attic) LSJ

au(ai/nw and au)ai/nw (au(an-) dry: au(anw= Soph., hi(/hna or au(/hna Hdt., hu(a/nqhn or au(a/nqhn Aristoph., fut. pass. au(anqh/somai Aristoph., fut. mid. au(anou=mai as pass. Soph. Mainly poetic and Ion., rare in Att. prose. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

au)c-a/nw and (less often) au)/cw (au)c-, au)ce-) make increase, grow: imperf. hu)/canon or hu)=con (hu)cano/mhn or hu)co/mhn), au)ch/sw, hu)/chsa, hu)/chka, hu)/chmai, hu)ch/qhn, au)chqh/somai (fut. pass. also au)ch/somai, 809), au)chte/os Aristotle. Cp. Epic and Ion. a)e/cw (-omai), imperf. a)/econ. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
a)fa/ssw (515 a) feel, handle (Hdt.): h)/fasa. Cp. Ion. and Epic a)fa/w or a(fa/w handle (rare in Att.); Hom. a(fo/wn, Ion. e)p-afh/sw, e)p-h/fhsa. (III.) LSJ
a)fi_/hmi let go: in the imperf. h)f-i_/hn or a)f-i_/hn. See 450. (Attic) LSJ
a)fu/ssw (a)fug-) dip up: a)fu/cw. Poetic, chiefly Epic. (III.) LSJ
a)fu/w dip up: h)/fusa (-a/mhn). Poetic, chiefly Epic. LSJ
a)/xqomai am vexed; as if from *a)xqe/omai (a)/xqe- for a)xqes-; cp. to\ a)/xqos distress) come a)xqe/somai, h)xqe/sqhn (489 e), fut. pass. as mid. a)xqesqh/somai (812). (Attic) LSJ
a)/x-numai (a)x-) am troubled, imperf. a)/xnuto *c 38. Poetic. (IV.) LSJ
a)/xomai (a)x-) am troubled. Epic present. LSJ

*a)/w satiate (cp. a(/-dhn sufficiently, Lat. sa-tis): a_)/sw, a)=sa, 2 aor. satiate myself (subj. e(/wmen or e(w=men, from h(omen, inf. a_)/menai). Mid. a)/atai (better a)/etai), a_)/somai, a_)sa/mhn, a)=tos (a)/-atos?). Epic. LSJ
a)/wrto: see ai)/rw. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with b
div2.p: badi/zw go: badiou=mai (806), beba/dika Aristotle, badiste/os. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ba/zw (bak-) speak, utter: ba/cw, be/baktai. Poetic. (III.) LSJ

bai/nw (ba-, ban-, 523 h) go: -bh/somai (806), 2 aor. -e/bhn (551, 682 a, 687), be/bhka, 2 perf. beba=si (subj. -bebw=si, 704 a), -be/bamai rare, -eba/qhn rare, bato/s, dia-bate/os. The simple verb appears in Att. prose only in the pres. and perf. act. Epic aor. mid. e)bhsa/mhn (rare) and e)bhso/mhn (542 D.). Causative (make go) are bh/sw poetic, e)/bhsa poetic and Ion. prose. Cp. also ba/skw, biba/w, bi/bhmi. 530. (III. IV.) (Attic) LSJ

ba/llw (bal-, blh-, 128 a, balle-) throw: balw= in good prose in comp. (ballh/sw Aristoph. of continued action), 2 aor. e)/balon (-o/mhn usu. in comp.), be/blhka, be/blhmai (opt. dia-beblh=|sqe, 711 d), e)blh/qhn, fut. pass. blhqh/somai, fut. perf. beblh/somai usu. in comp., a)po-blhte/os. Epic forms of the fut. are cumblh/seai; of the 2 aor. act. cum-blh/thn (688), cum-blh/menai; of the 2 aor
mid. as pass. e)blh/mhn (subj. blh/etai, opt. blh=|o or blei=o, inf. blh=sqai, part. blh/menos); of the perf. 2 s. be/blhai and 1 s. bebo/lhmai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ba/p-tw (baf-) dip: e)m-ba/yw, e)/baya, be/bammai, 2 aor. pass. e)ba/fhn (1 aor. pass. e)ba/fqhn Aristoph.), bapto/s. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
baru_/nw (barun-) load, annoy: barunw=, e)baru/nqhn. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ba/skw (ba-) go: poetic form of bai/nw. e)pibaske/men B 234 cause to go. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
basta/zw (bastad-) carry: basta/sw, e)ba/stasa. Poetic. Late forms are from bastag-. (III.) LSJ
bh/ttw (bhx-) cough. Ion. are bh/cw, e)/bhca. (Attic) LSJ
biba/zw (ba-) make go: usu. comp. W. a)na/, dia/, etc. in prose: -biba/sw (-omai) and -bibw= (539 d), -ebi/basa, e)biba/sqhn Aristotle, -bibaste/os. 447 a, 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
biba/w (ba-) step: part. bibw=n. Epic. LSJ
bi/bhmi (ba-) go: part. biba_/s. Epic. LSJ

bi-brw/-skw (brw-) eat: be/brwka (2 perf. part. bebrw/s poetic), be/brwmai, e)brw/qhn Hdt., fut. perf. bebrw/somai Hom., brwto/s Eur. Epic 2 aor. e)/brwn (688). In Att. other tenses than perf. act. and pass. are supplied from e)sqi/w. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

bio/w live (for pres. and imperf. za/w and bioteu/w were preferred): biw/somai (806), e)bi/wsa rare, 2 aor. e)bi/wn (687), bebi/wka, bebi/wtai (with the dat. of a pronoun), biwto/s, -te/os. (Attic) LSJ
(biw/skomai) usu. a)na-biw/skomai reanimate, revive intrans.: a)n-ebi/wsa late Att., intrans., a)n-ebiwsa/mhn reanimated, 2 aor. a)n-ebi/wn intrans. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

bla/p-tw (blab-) hurt, injure: bla/yw, e)/blaya, be/blafa, be/blammai, e)bla/fqhn and 2 aor. e)bla/bhn, fut. mid. bla/yomai (also as pass., 809), 2 fut. pass. blabh/somai, fut. perf. bebla/yomai Ion. Cp. bla/bomai am injured T 82. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
blast-a/nw (blast-, blaste-) sprout: 2 aor. e)/blaston, bebla/sthka (less often e)bla/sthka, 440 a). e)bla/sthsa Ion. and poetic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
ble/pw see: ble/yomai (806), e)/bleya, blepte/os, -to/s poetic. Hdt. has fut. a)nable/yw. ble/pomai is rare in pass. sense. (Attic) LSJ
bli/ttw for m(b)lit-i=w (from mlit-, cp. me/li, me/lit-os honey, 130) take honey: e)/blisa. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
blw/-skw for m(b)lw-skw from mol-, mlw- (130 D.) go: fut. molou=mai (806), 2 aor. e)/molon, perf. me/mblwka. Poetic. (V.) LSJ
boa/w shout: boh/somai (806), e)bo/hsa. Ion. are bw/somai, e)/bwsa, be/bwmai, e)bw/sqhn. Cp. 59 D. 1, 489 g. (Attic) LSJ
bo/-skw (bo-, bosk-, boske-) feed: boskh/sw and boskhte/os Aristoph. bo/skomai eat. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

bou/lomai (boul-, boule-) W. augment e)boul- or h)boul- (430) will, wish: boulh/somai, bebou/lhmai, e)boulh/qhn, boulhto/s, -te/os Aristotle. Epic 2 perf. probe/boula prefer. Hom. has also bo/lomai. (Attic) LSJ
brax-: 2 aor. (e)/)braxe, braxei=n resound. Epic. (Attic) LSJ
bre/xw wet: e)/breca, be/bregmai, e)bre/xqhn. (Attic) LSJ
bri/zw slumber, am drowsy: e)/brica. Poetic. 512. (III.) LSJ
bri_/qw am heavy: bri_/sw, e)/bri_sa, be/bri_qa. Mainly poetic. LSJ
brox- swallow, often W. a)na/, kata/: -e/broce, 2 perf. -be/broxe, 2 aor. pass. part. -broxei/s. The common verb is kata-broxqi/zw (Aristoph.). Epic. (Attic) LSJ
bru_/kw bite, grind the teeth: bru/cw (147 c), e)/bruca, 2 aor. e)/bruxon. Chiefly Ion. (Attic) LSJ

bru_xa/omai (bru_x-, 486) roar: be/bru_xa as pres. (poetic), a)n-ebru_xhsa/mhn Plato, bru_xhqei/s Soph.
(Attic) LSJ
brw/-qw eat: 2 perf. opt. bebrw/qois *d 35. Cp. bibrw/skw. LSJ
bu_ne/w (bu_- for bus-) stop up, often W. e)pi/, pro/: -bu_/sw, -e/bu_sa, be/busmai, para/bustos. Hdt. has dia-bu_/netai. Comic and Ion. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with g
div2.p: game/w (gam-, game-, 485) marry (of the man): fut. gamw=, e)/ghma, gega/mhka. Mid. game/omai (of the woman): fut. gamou=mai, e)ghma/mhn, gega/mhmai, v. a. gameto/s (gameth/ wife), -te/os. (Attic) LSJ
ga/-numai (ga-) rejoice: Epic fut. ganu/ssomai (W. nu of the pres. stem). Chiefly poetic. (IV.) LSJ

ge/gwna (gwn-, gwne-) 2 perf. as pres. shout: part. gegwnw/s Epic. Other forms may be referred to gegw/nw or gegwne/w; as subj. gegw/nw, imper. ge/gwne, inf. gegwne/men (Epic) and gegwnei=n, imperf. e)gegw/nei and e)ge/gwne, 1 pl. e)gegw/neun, fut. gegwnh/sw, aor. e)gegw/nhsa, v. a. gegwnhte/os. Poetic, occasionally in prose. By-form gegwni/skw. (Attic) LSJ
gei/nomai (gen-) am born Epic; aor. e)geina/mhn begat (poetic) yields in Hdt., Xen. geina/menos, geiname/nh parent. (III.) LSJ
gela/w (gela- for gelas-) laugh: gela/somai (806), e)ge/lasa, e)gela/sqhn (489 e), kata-ge/lastos. 488. (Attic) LSJ
ge/nto seized, Epic 2 aor. *s 476. Also = e)ge/neto (gi/gnomai). (Attic) LSJ
ghqe/w (ghq-, ghqe-, 485) rejoice: ge/ghqa as pres.; ghqh/sw and e)gh/qhsa poetic. (Attic) LSJ

ghra/-skw and less com. ghra/w (ghra-) grow old: ghra_/somai (806), less often ghra_/sw, e)gh/ra_sa, gegh/ra_ka am old. 2 aor. e)gh/ra_ Epic and Ion., inf. ghra=nai poetic, part. ghra_/s Hom. (687). (V.) (Attic) LSJ
ghru_/w (500. 1. a) speak out: ghru_/somai (806), e)gh/ru_sa, e)ghru_/qhn. Poetic. LSJ

gi/gnomai (gen-, gene-, gon-, 478) become, am: genh/somai, 2 aor. e)geno/mhn, 2 perf. ge/gona am, have been, gege/nhmai, genhqh/somai rare. gi_/nomai Doric and New Ion. (89). 2 aor. 3 s. ge/nto Epic; aor. pass. e)genh/qhn Doric, Ion., late Att. comedy; 2 perf. part. gegw/s (other -mi forms W. ga- for g&nnull;- 479, 482, 573, 704 b). (Attic) LSJ

gi-gnw/-skw (gnw-, gno-) know: gnw/somai (806), 2 aor. e)/gnwn (687) perceived, e)/gnwka, e)/gnwsmai (489 c), e)gnw/sqhn, gnwsqh/somai, gnwsto/s (gnwto/s poetic), -ste/os. 1 aor. a)n-e/gnwsa persuaded Hdt. Doric, New Ion. gi_nw/skw (89). (V.) (Attic) LSJ
glu/fw carve: ge/glummai and e)/glummai (440 a). Hdt. has e)ne/gluya. Other forms are late. (Attic) LSJ
gna/mp-tw (gnamp-) bend: gna/myw, e)/gnamya, a)n-egna/mfqhn. Poetic for ka/mptw. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
goa/w bewail: inf. goh/menai Hom., 2 aor. go/on (go-) Epic. Mid. goa/omai poetic: goh/somai Hom. LSJ

gra/fw write: gra/yw, e)/graya, ge/grafa, ge/grammai, 2 aor. pass. e)gra/fhn, 2 fut. pass. grafh/somai, fut. perf. pass. gegra/yomai, grapto/s, -te/os. gegra/fhka, e)/grammai, and e)gra/fqhn are late. (Attic) LSJ
gru/zw (grug-) grunt: gru/comai (806, late gru/cw); e)/gruca, grukto/s. Mostly in Att. comedy. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with d
div2.p: da- teach, learn, no pres.: 2 aor. e)/daon learned, redupl. de/daon taught, 2 aor. mid. dedae/sqai (deda/asqai MSS.), 1 perf. deda/hka (dae-) have learned, 2 perf. part. dedaw/s having learned, perf. mid. deda/hmai have learned, 2 aor. pass. as intrans. e)da/hn learned, 2 fut. pass. as intrans. dah/somai shall learn; a)-da/htos. Cp. Hom. dh/w shall find and dida/skw. Poetic, mainly Epic. (Attic) LSJ

dai-da/llw (daidal-, daidalo-) deck out: Pind. has perf. part. dedaidalme/nos, aor. part. daidalqei/s, and fut. inf. daidalwse/men. Epic and Lyric. (III.)
LSJ
dai+/zw (dai+g-) rend: dai+/cw, e)da/i+ca, deda/i+gmai, e)dai+/xqhn. Epic, Lyric, Tragic. (III.) LSJ

dai/-nu_mi (dai-) entertain: dai/nu_ Epic imperf. and pres. imper., dai/sw, e)/daisa. Mid. dai/numai feast (opt. dainu=to *w 665, cp. 750 D.), e)daisa/mhn, aor. pass. part. daisqei/s, a)/-daitos. Poetic, rare in Ion. prose. (IV.) LSJ
dai/omai divide: perf. 3 pl. dedai/atai a 23; subj. da/htai *u 316 (for dai/htai) from dai/omai or dai/w? Cp. date/omai. Poetic. LSJ
dai/w (dav-&iglide;w) kindle: 2 perf. de/dha burn intrans., plup. dedh/ei. Mid. dai/omai burn intrans. Mainly poetic. (III.) LSJ
da/k-nw (dak-, dhk-) bite: dh/comai (806), 2 aor. e)/dakon, de/dhgmai, e)dh/xqhn, daxqh/somai. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

dam-a/zw tame, subdue: fut. dama/sw, dama/w, damw= (Hom. 3 s. dama=| and dama/a|, 3 pl. damo/wsi, 645), aor. e)da/masa. Att. prose has only dama/zw, kat-edamasa/mhn, e)dama/sqhn. Mostly poetic, rare in prose. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
da/m-nh-mi (and dam-na/-w?) (dam-, dmh-) tame, subdue: perf. mid. de/dmhmai, pass. 1 aor. e)dmh/qhn and (more commonly) 2 aor. e)da/mhn, fut. perf. dedmh/somai. Poetic. 737. (IV.) LSJ
darq-a/nw (darq-, darqe-) sleep, usu. in comp., espec. W. kata/: 2 aor. -e/darqon (Hom. e)/draqon), perf. -deda/rqhka. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

date/omai (dat-, date-) divide: da/s(s)omai, a)n-edasa/mhn rare in prose (e)das- (s)a/mhn Epic), de/dasmai, a)na/-dastos. date/asqai in Hesiod should be date/esqai. Cp. dai/omai divide. Mainly poetic and New Ion. (Attic) LSJ
de/amai appear, only imperf. de/ato z 242. From a kindred root aor. doa/ssato N 458. LSJ
de/dia, de/doika, dei/dw (703) fear: see di-. (Attic) LSJ

dedi/ttomai frighten (rare in Att. prose): e)dedica/mhn rare. Poetic, mainly Epic, are dedi/ssomai, dedi/skomai, deidi/ssomai: fut. deidi/comai, aor. e)deidica/mhn. Derived from de/dia (di-). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
dei/dekto greeted I 224, deide/xatai h 72 (-ato *d 4) are referred by some to the mid. of dei/knu_mi. Others read dhk- from another root. Cp. deikano/wnto welcomed O 86. LSJ
deidi/skomai greet, only pres. and imperf., to be read dhdi/skomai (445 D., 527 b). Epic. (V.) LSJ

dei/k-nu_mi and deik-nu/-w (deik-) show (418): dei/cw, e)/deica, de/deixa, de/deigmai, e)dei/xqhn, deixqh/somai, deikte/os. Hdt. has forms from dek-: -de/cw, -e/deca (-a/mhn), -de/degmai, -ede/xqhn. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
de/mw (dem-, dmh-) build: e)/deima, de/dmhmai. Poetic and Ion. LSJ
de/rkomai (derk-, dork-, drak-) see: 2 aor. e)/drakon, perf. de/dorka as pres., pass. 1 aor. e)de/rxqhn (in tragedy) saw and 2 aor. e)dra/khn saw, mono/-derktos. Poetic. LSJ
de/rw (der-, dar-) flay: derw=, e)/deira, de/darmai, 2 aor. pass. e)da/rhn, drato/s Hom. Pres. dei/rw (der-&iglide;w) Hdt., Aristoph. (Attic) LSJ

de/xomai receive, await: de/comai, e)deca/mhn, de/degmai, ei)s-ede/xqhn, a)po-dekte/os. de/komai New Ion., Pindaric, and Aeolic. Fut. perf. as act. dede/comai poetic. On Epic e)de/gmhn, de/cai, de/xqai, de/gmenos, Hom. de/xatai (3 pl.), see 634, 688. (Attic) LSJ

de/w bind (397 a): dh/sw, e)/dhsa, de/deka (de/dhka doubtful), de/demai, e)de/qhn, fut. pass. deqh/somai, fut. perf. dedh/somai, su/n-detos, a)n-uto/-dhtos, sun-dete/os Aristoph. Mid. in prose only in comp., as peridh/somai. (Attic) LSJ

de/w (devw; de-, dee-) need, lack (397 a): deh/sw, e)de/hsa, dede/hka, dede/hmai, e)deh/qhn. Epic aor. dh=sen *s 100, e)deu/hsen i 540. Mid. de/omai want, ask (Epic deu/omai): deh/somai (Epic deuh/somai). Impers. dei= it is necessary: e)/dei, deh/sei, e)de/hse (397 a).
(Attic) LSJ

dhria/w and dhri_(w contend: e)dh/ri_sa Theocr. Mid. dhria/omai and dhri_(omai as act.: dhri_/somai Theocr., e)dhri_sa/mhn q 76, e)dhri/nqhn II 756 contended (as if from dhri/nw), a)mfi-dh/ri_tos Thuc. Epic and Lyric. LSJ
dh/w shall find, Epic pres. W. fut. meaning. Cp. da-. LSJ

di- (dvi-, dvei-, dvoi-) fear (477 a): e)/deisa, de/doika as pres., 2 perf. de/dia as pres. (rare in the sing.; inflection, 703). Epic forms: dei/dw (from dedvoia, 445 D.) as pres., dei/somai (806), e)/ddeisa ( = e)dveisa), dei/doika, dei/dia (703 D.). Hom. has imperf. di/on feared, fled from an assumed pres. di/w. (Attic) LSJ

diaita/w arbitrate (from di/aita, but augmented as if a comp. W. double augment in perf., plup., and in comps.; cp. 451): diaith/sw, dih/|thsa (but a)p-edih/|thsa), dedih/|thka (plup. kat-ededih|th/kh), dedih/|thmai (plup. e)c-ededih/|thto), dih|th/qhn. Mid. pass one's life: diaith/somai, kat-edih|thsa/mhn effected arbitration. (Attic) LSJ

dia_kone/w minister (from dia_/konos): e)dia_ko/noun, dia_konh/sw, dedia_ko/nhka, dedia_ko/nhmai, e)dia_konh/qhn. Forms in dedih- are wrong, forms in dih- are Ion. and late (uncertain in classical poetry). (Attic) LSJ

di-da/-skw (for didax-skw, 97 a) teach, mid. cause to teach, learn: dida/cw, e)di/daca, dedi/daxa, dedi/dagmai, e)dida/xqhn, dida/comai (808), didakto/s, -te/os. Epic aor. e)dida/skhsa (didaske-) 447 a. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
di/-dh-mi (dh-, de-) bind, pres. and imperf. Poetic for de/w. Xen. has dide/a_si. (Attic) LSJ

di-dra_/-skw (dra_-) run away, only in comp. W. a)po/, e)c: -dra_/somai (806), 2 aor. -e/dra_n (-drw=, -drai/hn, -dra=qi late, -dra=nai, -dra_/s, 687), -de/dra_ka. Hdt. has -didrh/skw, -drh/somai, -e/drhn (but -dra_s), -de/drhka. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

di/-dw-mi (dw-, do-) give: see 416, 421. Fut. dw/sw, 1 aor. e)/dwka in s., 2 aor. e)/doton dual, e)/domen pl. (756), de/dwka, de/domai, e)do/qhn, doqh/somai, doto/s, -te/os. See 747 ff. for pres. in Hom. and Hdt. Fut. didw/sw Epic, 2 aor. iter. do/skon (492 a). (Attic) LSJ
di/-zh-mai (from di-d&iglide;h-) seek (cp. zhte/w) keeps h throughout in the pres. (imperf. e)dizh/mhn), dizh/somai, e)dizhsa/mhn. Poetic and Ion. 726 a, 741. LSJ

di/h-mi cause to flee, only in imperf. e)n-di/esan set on *s 584. Mid. di/emai flee, cause to flee, subj. di/wmai (accent 424 c, N. 2), opt. dioi/mhn (accent 424 c, N. 2), inf. di/esqai referred by some to the middle of di/w. Epic. LSJ
dik- only in 2 aor. e)/dikon threw. In Pindar and the tragic poets. LSJ
diya/w (diya-, diyh-) thirst: pres. see 394, 641: diyh/sw, e)di/yhsa. (Attic) LSJ
di/w: see di-. LSJ
diw/kw pursue: diw/comai (806) and (less well supported) diw/cw, e)di/wca, dedi/wxa, e)diw/xqhn, diwkte/os. For e)diw/kaqon see 490 D. (Attic) LSJ

doke/w (dok-, doke-, 485) seem, think: do/cw, e)/doca, de/dogmai, kat-edo/xqhn, a)-do/khtos. Poetic forms are dokh/sw, e)do/khsa, dedo/khmai, e)dokh/qhn. In trimeter Aristoph. uses only the shorter forms. (Attic) LSJ
doupe/w (doup-, doupe-) sound heavily: e)dou/phsa, 2 perf. de/doupa fell. Epic aor. e)gdou/phsa. Poetic. LSJ
dra/ttomai (drag-) seize: e)draca/mhn, de/dragmai. (III.) LSJ
dra/w do: dra_/sw, e)/dra_sa, de/dra_ka, de/dra_mai (de/drasmai, 489 e, doubtful), e)dra_/sqhn, dra_ste/os. (Attic) LSJ

dre/pw pluck: e)/dreya, 2 aor. e)/drapon Pind., a)/-dreptos Aesch. Cp. dre/p-tw poetic. du/namai am able, can (augment usually e)dun-, but also h)dun-, 430): dunh/somai, dedu/nhmai, e)dunh/qhn, dunato/s. Pres. 2 s. du/nasai, du/na| poetic, du/nh| Ion. (465 a, N. 2), imperf. e)du/nw (e)du/naso late), aor. pass. e)duna/sqhn Epic, New Ion., Pind. (489 g).
(Attic) LSJ

du_/w enter, go down, sink, cause to enter (trans. generally in comp. W. a)po/ or kata/ (819): also du_/-nw (Ion., poetic, rare in Xen.) enter: -du_/sw trans., -e/du_sa trans., 2 aor. e)/du_n intrans. (p. 140), de/du_ka intrans., -de/du=ka trans., -de/dumai, -edu/qhn, -duqh/somai Aristoph., -dute/os. Fut. mid. du_/somai, aor. mid. -edu_sa/mhn (Epic also e)du_so/mhn, 542 D.). Hom. 2 aor. opt. du_/h and e)kdu=men (758 D). (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with e
div2.p: e(a/fqh N 543, aor. pass., was hurled (?), possibly from vap- (i)a/ptw); sometimes referred to a(/ptw or to e(/pomai. LSJ

e)a/w permit, let alone: e)a_/sw, ei)/a_sa (431), ei)/a_ka (443), ei)/a_mai, ei)a_/qhn, e)a_/somai pass. (808), e)a_te/os. Epic pres. also ei)a/w, imperf. e)/a_ E 517, aor. e)/a_sa; Hdt. does not augment. (Attic) LSJ
e)ggua/w pledge: the forms in h)ggu- are better than those in e)negu- or e)ggegu-; see 453 a. (Attic) LSJ

e)gei/rw (e)ger-, e)gor-, e)gr-, 36) wake, rouse: e)gerw=, h)/geira, 2 perf. e)/grh/gora 478, 705 am awake (for e)g-hgora, but r is also redupl.), e)gh/germai, h)ge/rqhn, 2 aor. mid. h)gro/mhn awoke, e)gerte/os, e)gerto/s Aristotle. Hom. 2 perf. 3 pl. e)grhgo/rqa_si, imper. e)grh/gorqe (for -gorsqe), inf. e)grh/gorqai or e)grhgo/rqai (for -gorsqai). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
e)gkwmia/zw praise: e)gkwmia/sw and e)gkwmia/somai (806), e)nekwmi/asa, e)gkekwmi/aka, e)gkekwmi/asmai, e)nekwmia/sqhn Hdt. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
e)/dw eat: poetic for e)sqi/w. (Attic) LSJ

e(/zomai (e(d- for sed-, cp. sedeo) sit, usu. kaq-e/zomai (which is less common than kaq-i/zomai): e)kaq-ezo/mhn (450), kaq-edou=mai (539 b), ei(sa/mhn rare in prose, kaq-este/os. Fut. e)f-e/ssomai trans. i 455, aor. e(ssa/mhn and e)essa/mhn Epic. Act. aor. Epic ei)=sa (imper. e(/sson or ei(=son, inf. e(/ssai, part. e(/sa_s). See i(/zw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

e)qe/lw (e)qel-, e)qele-) and qe/lw wish: imperf. always h)/qelon in Att.; e)qelh/sw, or qelh/sw (rare); h)qe/lhsa (subj. e)qelh/sw or qelh/sw, opt. e)qelh/saimi or qelh/saimi), h)qe/lhka. The commoner Att. form is e)qe/lw except in the iambic trimeter of tragedy, and in formulas as a_)\n qeo\s qe/lh|. (Attic) LSJ
e)qi/zw (for sveq-id&iglide;w, 123) accustom: e)qiw= (539 e), ei)/qisa (431), ei)/qika (443), ei)/qismai (1946), ei)qi/sqhn, e)qiste/os, -to/s Aristotle. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

e)/qw (for sveqw, 123) am accustomed: pres. part. e)/qwn being accustomed only in Hom., 2 perf. ei)/wqa (443, 563 a) am accustomed, 2 plup. ei)w/qh (perf. e)/wqa, plup. e)w/qea Hdt.). See e)qi/zw. (Attic) LSJ
ei)=don saw: see i)d- and o(ra/w. (Attic) LSJ

ei)ka/zw (ei)kad-) liken, conjecture augments to h)|k- rather than to ei)k- in Att. prose (437): h)/|kazon, ei)ka/sw, h)/|kasa, h)/|kasmai (ei)/kasmai?), h)|ka/sqhn, ei)kasqh/somai, ei)kasto/s, a)p-eikaste/os. Fut. mid. -eika/somai sometimes as act. (Attic) LSJ
ei)/kw yield: ei)/cw, ei)=ca, u(p-eikte/os. On ei)/kaqon see 490. (Attic) LSJ

ei)/kw (ei)k-, oi)k-, i)k-; for veik-, etc.) resemble, appear (no pres. in use): ei)/cw rare, 2 perf. e)/oika as pres. 443, 502 a (impers. e)/oike it seems): e)oi/kw, e)oi/koimi, e)oike/nai (poet. ei)ke/nai), e)oikw/s, neut. ei)ko/s fitting (ei)kw/s chiefly poetic; also Platonic); 2 plup. e)w/|kh and h)/|kh. ei)=ke seemed likely (*s 520) may be imperf.; some regard it as perf. or plup. For e)/oika, e)oi/kw, e)oikw/s Hdt. has oi)=ka, oi)/kw, oi)kw/s. Forms of the mi-conjugation are e)/i+kton, e)i+/kthn Hom., e)/oigmen Att. poets, ei)/ca_si mainly in Att. poets (704 d.). Cp. e)i+/skw. (Attic) LSJ

ei)le/w or ei(le/w roll up, pack close, mostly Epic. ei)le/omai Hdt., sun-eile/omai Xen.?? a)p-ei/lhmai Hdt., a)n-eilh/qhn Thuc.
(Attic) LSJ
ei)/llw roll pres. act. and pass. in Att. (rare). Cp. i)/llw. (Attic) LSJ
ei)lu_/w (veilu- for e)-vlu-) roll, cover, gather up: ei)lu_/sw, ei)/lu_mai. Cp. e)lu/w. Poetic and Ion. LSJ

ei)/lw (e)l- for vel-, cp. volvere) roll up, drive together: no pres. act. (ei)/lomai Hom.), e)/lsa and e)/elsa, e)/elmai, 2 aor. pass. e)a/lhn and a)/lhn (3 pl. a)/len, inf. a)lh=nai, a)lh/menai, part. a)lei/s). Homeric. LSJ
ei(/martai it is fated: see mei/romai. (Attic) LSJ
ei)mi/ am: fut. e)/somai (806). See p. 211. (Attic) LSJ
ei)=mi go: see p. 212. (Attic) LSJ

ei)=pon (e)p- for vep-,) said, 2 aor. (ei)/pw, ei)/poimi, ei)pe/, ei)pei=n, ei)pw/n), Epic e)/eipon and ei)/peskon. First aor. ei)=pa rare in Att. (ei)/paimi, imper. ei)=pon, inf. ei)=pai Hdt., part. ei)/pa_s Hdt. and late Att.), e)/eipa poetic; 1 aor. mid. a)p-eipa/mhn New Ion. Other tenses are supplied from ei)/rw. 529. (VI.) (Attic) LSJ

ei)/rgw shut in or out, also ei(/rgnu_mi and (rarely) ei(rgnu/w (with ei- from ee-, cp. Hom. e)(v)e/rgw): ei)/rcw, ei)=rca, ei)=rgmai, ei)/rxqhn, ei(rkto/s, -te/os. Fut. mid. ei)/rcomai is pass. or reflex. (808). The distinction that the forms with the smooth breathing mean shut out, those with the rough breathing mean shut in, is late and not always observed in classical Att. Hom. has e)e/rgw (in pres.) and e)/rgw shut in or out: e)/rca, 2 aor. e)/rgaqon and e)e/rgaqon, e)/rgmai and e)/ergmai (3 pl. e)/rxatai, 439 D., plup. e)/rxato, e)e/rxato), e)/rxqhn. Hom. has e)e/rgnu_ K 238. Hdt. usu. has e)/rgw (in comp.), with some forms from -e/rgnu_mi and e)rgnu/w. Old Att. forms in e)rg-, e(rg- are doubtful: Soph. has -e/rcw, e)/rcetai; Plato -e/rca_s. (Attic) LSJ

ei)/romai (ei)r-, ei)re-) ask: ei)rh/somai Hom. and New Ion. Hom. has also (rarely) e)re/(v)w, subj. e)rei/omen ( = e)reu/omen) *l 62; and e)re/(v)omai, imper. e)/reio or e)rei=o *l 611 (650). Att. fut. e)rh/somai and 2 aor. h)ro/mhn presuppose a pres. e)/romai, which is supplied by e)rwta/w. (Attic) LSJ
ei)/rw (e)r- for ser-, cp. Lat. sero) join: rare except in comp. W. a)po/, dia/, su/n, etc.: aor. -ei=ra (Ion. -ersa), perf. -ei=rka, perf. mid. e)/ermai Epic. (Attic) LSJ

ei)/rw Hom. say (e)r-, r(h- for ver-, vrh-, cp. Lat. verbum), for which pres. Att. uses le/gw, fhmi/ and (esp. in comp.) a)goreu/w: fut. e)rw=, aor. supplied by ei)=pon, perf. ei)/rhka ( = ve-vrh-ka), perf. pass. ei)/rhmai, aor. pass. e)rrh/qhn, fut. pass. r(hqh/somai, fut. perf. ei)rh/somai, v. a. r(hto/s, -te/os. Ion. are e)re/w fut., ei)re/qhn (but r(hqh=nai) aor. pass. (Attic) LSJ
ei)=sa seated: see i(/zw. LSJ

e)i+/skw ( = ve-vik-skw, from redupl. vik-) liken (also i)/skw): imperf. Hom. h)/i+skon and e)/i+skon; perf. mid. prosh/i+cai art like Eur., plup. Hom. h)/i+kto and e)/i+kto have been referred by some to ei)/kw. Poetic, chiefly Epic. (V.) LSJ
ei)/wqa: see e)/qw. (Attic) LSJ
e)kklhsia/zw call an assembly: augments e)c-eklhsi/azon or h)k-klhsi/azon, etc. (453 a). (Attic) LSJ

e)lau/nw (from e)la-nu-w, 523 e) drive, march: e)lw= (539 b), h)/lasa, -elh/laka (W. a)po/, e)c), e)lh/lamai, h)la/qhn, e)late/os, e)c-h/latos Hom., e)lato/s Aristotle. Aor. mid. h)lasa/mhn rare. Fut. e)la/ssw y 427, e)lo/wsi Hom. (645), e)la/sw rarely in MSS. of Xen., perf. e)lh/lasmai Ion. and late, plup. h)lhla/mhn (Hom. 3 pl. e)lhla/dato or e)lhle/ato or e)lhle/dato), h)la/sqhn Hdt., Aristotle (489 g). e)la/w is rare and poetic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

e)le/gxw examine, confute: e)le/gcw, h)/legca, e)lh/legmai (407), h)le/gxqhn, e)legxqh/somai, e)legkte/os.
(Attic) LSJ
e)leli/zw raise the war-cry, shout: h)le/lica Xen. 512. (III.) LSJ
e)leli/zw whirl, turn round: e)le/lica, e)leli/xqhn. Poetic. 512. (III.) LSJ

e)li/ttw (e)lik- for velik-) roll (rarely ei)li/ttw); sometimes written e(l-: e)li/cw, ei)/lica (431), ei)/ligmai (443), ei)li/xqhn, e)c-elixqh/somai Aristotle, ei)likto/s. Epic aor. mid. e)lica/mhn. Epic e)le/likto, e)leli/xqhsan should be e)el-. ei)li/ssw is the usual form in Hdt. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

e(/lkw draw (e(lk- for selk-; most tenses from e(lku-; e(lku/w late), often W. a)na/, e)c, kata/, su/n: -e/lcw, ei(/lkusa (431), kaq-ei/lkuka (443), -ei/lkusmai (489 c), -eilku/sqhn, -elkusqh/somai, e(lkte/os, sun-elkuste/os. Fut. e(lku/sw Ion. and late. By-form e(lke/w Epic. (Attic) LSJ
e)/lpw (velp-) cause to hope, mid. (also e)e/lpomai) hope like e)lpi/zw: 2 perf. as pres. e)/olpa ( = vevolpa), 2 plup. e)w/lpea, v. a. a)/-elptos. Mainly Epic. (Attic) LSJ
e)lu/w roll: e)lu/sqhn Hom. ( = e)-vlu-sqhn), 489 e. Cp. ei)lu/w. LSJ
e)me/w vomit: e)mou=mai (806), h)/mesa. (Attic) LSJ
e)nai/rw (e)nar-) kill: 2 aor. h)/naron. 1 aor. mid. e)nhra/mhn as act. Poetic. (III.) LSJ
e)nari/zw slay, spoil: e)nari/cw, e)na/rica, kat-hna/rismai, kat-hnari/sqhn. Poetic. 512. (III.) LSJ
e)n-edreu/w waylay, lie in ambush regular: fut. mid. as pass. (808). (Attic) LSJ

e)n-e/pw and e)nne/pw (e)n + sep-, sp-, spe-) say, tell: e)ni-sph/sw and e)ni/yw (e)ni/-spw?), 2 aor. e)/ni-spon (e)ni/-spw, e)ni/-spoimi, imper. e)ni/-spes or e)/ni-spe, 2 pl. e)/spete for e)n-spete, inf. e)ni-spei=n and e)ni-spe/men). Poetic. LSJ
e)nh/noqe defect., W. pres. and imperf. meaning: sit on, be on, grow on, lie on. In comp. W. e)pi/ in Hom. Epic. Connected by some W. a)nh/noqe. LSJ
e)ni/p-tw (e)n-ip) chide: 2 aor. e)ne/ni_pon and h)n-i_/p-apon (448 D.). Epic also e)ni/ssw. Poetic, chiefly Epic. (II.) LSJ

e)/n-nu_mi (e(- for ves-, cp. ves-tio) clothe, pres. act. only in comp., in prose a)mfie/nnu_mi: a)mfi-w= (539 c), h)mfi/-esa (450), h)mfi/-esmai (489 d). Epic forms: imperf. kata-ei/nuon, fut. e(/ssw and -e/sw, aor. e(/ssa and -esa, mid. pres. inf. e)p-ei/nusqai Hdt., fut. -e/ssomai, aor. e(s(s)a/mhn and e(essa/mhn for e)-vessamhn, perf. e(/smai and ei(=mai (part. ei(me/nos in tragedy). Cp. 439 D. The simple verb is poetic, mainly Epic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
e)n-oxle/w harass has double augment (451): h)n-w/xloun (e)n-w/xloun Aristotle), e)n-oxlh/sw, h)n-w/xlhsa, h)n-w/xlhmai. (Attic) LSJ
e)ceta/zw investigate: e)ceta/sw (rarely e)cetw=, 539 d), e)ch/tasa, e)ch/taka, e)ch/tasmai, e)chta/sqhn, e)cetasqh/somai, e)cetaste/os. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
e)/oika seem, resemble: see ei)/kw. (Attic) LSJ
e(orta/zw keep festival: e(w/rtasa (for h(or-, 34). Ion. o(rta/zw. (Attic) LSJ

e)p-aure/w and e)p-auri/skw (au)r-, au)re-) enjoy (Epic and Lyric) are both rare: 2 aor. e)pau=ron. Mid. e)pauri/skomai Ion., poetic, rare in Att. prose: e)paurh/somai, e)phura/mhn rare, 2 aor. e)phuro/mhn. (V.) LSJ
e)penh/noqe: see e)nh/noqe. LSJ
e)pibouleu/w plot against: regular, but fut. mid. as pass. (808). (Attic) LSJ

e)pi/stamai understand (725): 2 s. e)pi/stasai, e)pi/sta| and e)pi/sth| poetic (465 a, N. 2), -epi/steai Hdt.; subj. e)pi/stwmai (accent, 424 c, N. 2), opt. e)pistai/mhn, e)pi/staio (accent, 424 c, N. 2), imper. e)pi/stw (e)pi/staso poetic and New Ion.), imperf. h)pista/mhn, h)pi/staso and h)pi/stw (450, 465 b, N. 1), fut. e)pisth/somai, aor. h)pisth/qhn, v. a. e)pisthto/s. Distinguish e)f-i/stamai from e)f-i/sthmi. (Attic) LSJ

e(/pw (sep-, sp-) am busy about, usu. W. a)mfi/, dia/, e)pi/, meta/, peri/ (simple only in
part.): imperf. -ei=pon (Epic also -epon W. no augm.), fut. -e/yw, 2 aor. -e/spon for e)-s(e)pon (-spw=, -spoi=mi, -spw=n, -spei=n), aor. pass. peri-e/fqhn Hdt. The act. forms are poetic, Ion. (imperf. and fut. also Xenophontic). Mid. e(/pomai follow: ei(po/mhn (431), e)/yomai, 2 aor. e(spo/mhn (spw=mai, spoi/mhn, spou=, spe/sqai, spo/menos). Hom. has spei=o for spou=. For e(/spwmai, e(spoi/mhn, e(spe/sqw, etc., following an elided vowel in the MSS. of Hom. we probably have, not a redupl. aor. without augment (e(sp- for se-sp-), but wrong readings for spw=mai etc. with the vowel of the preceding word unelided. (Attic) LSJ
e)pria/mhn bought: see pria- (416). (Attic) LSJ

e)/ramai (poetic) deponent pass., pres. in prose supplied by e)ra/w (e)ra- for e)ras-): imperf. h)/rwn (h)ra/mhn poetic); aor. h)ra/sqhn fell in love, 489 e (h)ras(s)a/mhn poetic), fut. e)rasqh/somai poetic, e)rasto/s, e)rato/s poetic. (Attic) LSJ

e)rga/zomai (verg-) work, augments to h)- and ei)- (431, 432), redupl. to ei)- (443): h)rgazo/mhn, e)rga/somai, h)rgasa/mhn, ei)/rgasmai, h)rga/sqhn, e)rgasqh/somai, e)rgaste/os. In Hdt. without augment and reduplication. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
e)/rgw: see ei)/rgw. (Attic) LSJ

e)/rdw (from verzw = verg-&iglide;w, 511) work, do (also e(/rdw): e)/rcw, e)/rca, 2 perf. e)/orga ( = vevorga), 2 plup. e)w/rgea ( = e)vevorgea) Epic, e)o/rgea Hdt. Ion. and poetic; cp. r(e/zw. (III.) LSJ

e)rei/dw prop: h)/reisa, e)rh/reismai Hdt. (for Hom. e)rhre/datai, -ato some read e)rhri/datai, -ato), plup. h)rh/reisto, h)rei/sqhn, e)rei/somai Aristotle, e)reisa/mhn Hom. Hippocr. has -h/reika, -h/reismai, e)rhrei/setai. Mainly poetic. (Attic) LSJ
e)rei/kw (e)reik-, e)rik-) tear, burst: h)/reica, 2 aor. h)/rikon trans. and intrans., e)rh/rigmai. Poetic and New Ion. LSJ
e)rei/pw (e)reip-, e)rip-) throw down: e)rei/yw, h)/reiya, 2 aor. h)/ripon, 2 perf. -erh/ripa have fallen Epic (plup. e)re/ripto *c 15), h)rei/fqhn, 2 aor. pass. e)ri/phn. Ion. and poetic. LSJ
e)re/ssw (e)ret-) row: di-h/res(s)a Hom. Late prose has e)re/ssw and e)re/ttw. (III.) LSJ
e)re/w ask Epic: see ei)/romai. LSJ
e)ridai/nw (e)ridan-) contend Epic (III. IV.). e)ri_dh/sasqai *y 792 (v. l. e)rizh/sasqai) as if from e)ri_de/omai. By-form e)ridmai/nw Epic. LSJ
e)ri/zw (e)rid-) contend: h)/ris(s)a, e)rh/rismai, e)risto/s. Poetic. (III.) LSJ
e)/romai ask: see ei)/romai. LSJ
e(/rpw (serp-) and e(rpu/zw creep augment to ei(- (431): ei(=rpon, e)f-e/ryw, ei(/rpusa, e(rpeto/n a beast. (Attic) LSJ
e)/rrw (e)rr-, e)rre-) go away, go (to destruction), perish: e)rrh/sw, h)/rrhsa, ei)sh/rrhka. (Attic) LSJ
e)rugg-a/nw cast forth, eruct: pres. Att., poetic, New Ion., 2 aor. h)/rugon. Cp. e)reu/gomai Epic, New Ion.: e)reu/comai Hippocr. (806). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
e)ru_/kw hold back: e)ru/cw, h)/ruca (also Xen.), 2 aor. h)ru_/kakon (448 D.). Epic, poetic, New Ion. Hom. has also e)ru_ka/nw, e)ru_kana/w. LSJ

e)/ru_mai (for veru_mai) and ei)/rumai (for e)vru_mai) protect Epic: pres. 3 pl. ei)ru/atai and ei)ru_/atai (for ei)/runtai), inf. e(i)/)rusqai; imperf. e(i)/)ru_to, ei)ru/ato (for ei)/runto); fut. e(i))ru/s(s)omai; aor. e(i))rus(s)a/mhn, perf. e)/ru^to Hesiod. The pres. and imperf. are often taken as mi-forms of e)ru/omai. By-form r(u_/omai, q. v. LSJ

e)ru/w (veru-, vru_-) draw: augments to ei)- (431 D): fut. e)ru/w Hom.; aor. e(i)/)rus(s)a Hom. Mid. e)ru/omai draw to one's self: e)ru/ssomai, e(i))rus(s)a/mhn,
ei)/ru_mai and ei)/rusmai 489 d (3 pl. ei)ru/atai and ei)ru_/atai), plup. ei)ru_/mhn (3 pl. ei)ru_/ato), e(i))ru/sqhn Hippocr., e)rusto/s Soph. Epic and Ion. ei)ru/w is poetic (esp. Epic) and New Ion. Late fut. e)ru/s(s)w. LSJ

e)/rxomai (e)rx-, e)lq-, e)leuq-, e)luq-) go, come: e)leu/somai, 2 aor. h)=lqon, 2 perf. e)lh/luqa. In Att. e)/rxomai is common only in indic.; subj. Epic and Ion.; opt. (in comp.) Xen.; imper. Epic; inf. Epic, Tragic, Ion., in comp. in Att. prose rarely; part. poetic, in comp. in Att. prose. Imperf. h)rxo/mhn uncomp. is rare. For the above tenses Att. prose uses i)/w, i)/oimi, i)/qi, i)e/nai, i)w/n, h)=|a simple and in comp. (but not u(pie/nai for u(pe/rxqesqai flatter). Fut.: Att. prose uses ei)=mi (774), a)fi/comai or h(/cw for e)leu/somai (which is Epic, Ion., Tragic); 2 aor. h)/luqon poetic; 2 perf. e)lh/louqa or ei)lh/louqa Epic, e)lh/lumen, -ute in Comic and Tragic fragments; 2 plup. e)lhlu/qei Epic. (VI.) (Attic) LSJ

e)s-qi/w (for e)d-qi-w) eat: imperf. h)/sqion, fut. e)/domai (541, 806), 2 aor. e)/fagon, perf. e)dh/doka, kat-edh/desmai, e)desto/s, -te/os. Epic are e)/dmenai pres., e)dhdw/s 2 perf. part., e)dh/domai (?) perf. pass.; h)de/sqhn Comic, Hippocr., Aristotle. (VI.) e)/sqw Epic and poetic, e)/dw Epic, poetic, and Ion. (Attic) LSJ
e(stia/w entertain augments and reduplicates to ei(- (431, 443). (Attic) LSJ

eu(/dw sleep, rare in prose, which usually has kaq-eu/dw: imperf. e)ka/q-eudon and kaq-hu=don (450), fut. kaq-eudh/sw, v. a. kaq-eudhte/os. ei(/dw is chiefly poetic and Ion. (imperf. eu(=don and hu(=don). (Attic) LSJ
eu)ergete/w do good. The augmented form eu)hr- is to be rejected (452). (Attic) LSJ

eu(r-i/skw (eu(r-, eu(re-) find: eu(rh/sw, 2 aor. hu(=ron or eu(=ron (imper. eu(re/, 424 b), hu(/rhka or eu(/rhka, eu(/rhmai, eu(re/qhn, eu(reqh/somai, eu(reto/s, -te/os; eu(ra/mhn Hesiod. The augment is hu(- or eu(- (437). (V.) (Attic) LSJ
eu)frai/nw (eu)fran-) cheer: eu)franw=, hu)/fra_na. Mid. rejoice: eu)franou=mai and eu)franqh/somai, hu)fra/nqhn. The augment is also eu)- (437). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
eu)/xomai pray, boast: eu)/comai, hu)ca/mhn, hu)=gmai, eu)kto/s, -te/os Hippocr., a)p-eu/xetos Aesch. The augment is also eu)- (437). (Attic) LSJ
e)xqai/rw (e)xqar-) hate: e)xqarw=, e)xqarou=mai (808), h)/xqhra, e)xqarte/os. Epic and poetic. (III.) LSJ
e)/xqw hate, e)/xqomai: only pres. and imperf. Poetic for a)p-exqa/nomai. (Attic) LSJ

e)/xw (e)x-, for sex-, and sx-, sxe-) have, hold: imperf. ei)=xon (431), e(/cw or sxh/sw (1911), 2 aor. e)/sxon for e)-s(e)x-on (sxw=, sxoi/hn or -sxoimi, sxe/s, sxei=n, sxw/n), e)/sxhka, par-e/sxhmai, e(kte/os, a)na-sxeto/s, -te/os. Mid. e)/xomai hold by, am near: e(/comai (sometimes pass., 808), and sxh/somai (often in comp.), 2 aor. e)sxo/mhn usu. in comp. (sxw=mai, sxoi/mhn, sxou=, sxe/sqai, sxo/menos), used as pass. for e)sxe/qhn (late). Epic forms are perf. sun-o/xwka (for -ok-ox-a) B 218, plup. pass. e)p-w/xato were shut M 340. Poetic is 2 aor. e)/sxeqon (490 D.). See a)mpe/xw, a)ne/xw, u(pisxne/omai. By-form i)/sxw for si-s(e)x-w. (Attic) LSJ
e(/yw (e(y-, e(ye-) cook, boil: e(yh/somai (e(yh/sw Comic), h(/yhsa, e(fqo/s (for e(yqos), e(yhto/s, h(/yhmai Hippocr., h(yh/qhn Hdt. The pres. e(ye/w is not Att. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with z
div2.p: *za/w (zw=) live (za-, zh-, 395): (zh=|s. zh=|): imperf. e)/zwn, fut. zh/sw and zh/somai. For late e)/zhsa, e)/zhka Att. has e)bi/wn, bebi/wka. bi/wsomai is commoner than zh/somai. zw/w Epic, New Ion., dramatic. See 522 b, 641 and D. (Attic) LSJ
zeu/g-nu_mi (zeug-, zug-, cp. Lat. jugum) yoke: zeu/cw, e)/zeuca, e)/ceugmai, e)zeu/xqhn rare, 2 aor. pass. e)zu/ghn. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

ze/w (ze- for zes-) boil (intrans. in prose): e)cana-ze/sw, e)/zesa a)p-e/zesmai Hippocr.
(Attic) LSJ
zw/n-nu_mi (zw-, 731) gird: e)/zwsa, e)/zwmai (Att. inscr.) and e)/zwsmai (preferred in MSS.). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with h
div2.p: h(ba_/-skw come to manhood, h(ba/w am at manhood: e)f-hbh/sw, h(/bhsa, par-h/bhka, Epic h(bw/onta, etc. (643). (V.) (Attic) LSJ
h)gere/qomai am collected: see a)gei/rw. (Attic) LSJ
h(/domai am pleased: h(sqh/somai (812), h(/sqhn, aor. mid. h(sa/mhn i 353. h(/dw (h(=sa) is very rare. (Attic) LSJ
h(du_/nw (h(dun-) sweeten: h(/du_na, h(/dusmai, h(du/nqhn, h(dunte/os. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
h)ere/qomai am raised: see ai)/rw. (Attic) LSJ
h(=mai sit: see 789. LSJ
h)mi/ say: see 792. (Attic) LSJ
h)mu/w sink, bow: h)/mu_sa, u(p-emn-h/mu_ke X 491 from e)m-hmu_ke with n inserted. Poetic, mostly Epic. LSJ
h(ttw=mai from h)tta/omai (Ion. e(ssou=mai from e(sso/omai) am vanquished: regular, but fut. h(tth/somai and h(tthqh/somai (812). (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with q
div2.p: qa/llw (qal-) bloom, rare in prose: e)/qalle made grow Pind., 2 perf. te/qhla (as pres.) is poetic. By-form qale/qw (490). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
qa/p-tw (qaf-, 125 g) bury: qa/yw, e)/qaya, te/qammai, 2 aor. pass. e)ta/fhn, 2 fut. pass. tafh/somai, fut. perf. teqa/yomai, qapte/os; 1 aor. pass. e)qa/fqhn Ion. (rare). (II.) (Attic) LSJ
qauma/zw (qaum-ad-) wonder, admire: fut. qauma/somai (806), otherwise regular. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
qei/nw (qen-) smite: qenw=, e)/qeina Epic, 2 aor. e)/qenon. Poetic (and in Att. comedy). (III.) LSJ
qe/lw wish: see e)qe/lw. (Attic) LSJ
qerapeu/w serve, heal: regular, but fut. mid. qerapeu/somai is usu. pass. (808). (Attic) LSJ
qe/romai warm myself (in prose only pres. and imperf.), fut. qe/rsomai t 23 (536), 2 aor. pass. as intrans. e)qe/rhn (only in the subj. qere/w r 23). (Attic) LSJ
qe/w (qeu-, qev-, qu-, 503) run: qeu/somai (806). Other forms supplied by other verbs (see tre/xw). (Attic) LSJ
qh- in qh=sqai milk, e)qhsa/mhn sucked. Epic. LSJ
qhp-: see taf-. LSJ
qi-g-g-a/nw (qig-) touch: qi/comai (806), 2 aor. e)/qigon, a)/-qiktos. Poetic, rare in prose (Xen.). (IV.) LSJ
qla/w bruise, break: qla/sw, e)/qlasa, te/qlasmai (489 c) Theocr., e)qla/sqhn Hippocr., qlasto/s. Ion. and poetic. See fla/w. LSJ
qli_/bw (qli_b-, qli^b-, 501) press: e)/qli_ya, te/qli^fa, e)qli_/fqhn, te/qlimmai and e)qli^/bhn Aristotle. Fut. mid. qli_/yomai Hom. (Attic) LSJ

qnh/|-skw, older qnh/-skw (qan-, qnh-, 492, 526 b) die: a)po-qanou=mai (806), 2 aor. a)p-e/qanon, te/qnhka am dead, 2 perf. te/qnaton (704 c), fut. perf. teqnh/cw (659 a, 1958), qnhto/s. In prose regularly a)po-qnh/|skw in fut. and 2 aor., but always te/qnhka. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
qra_/ttw (qra_x-, tra_x-) disturb: e)/qra_ca, e)qra_/xqhn Soph. See tara/ttw. Mostly poetic. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
qrau/w break, bruise: qrau/sw, e)/qrausa, te/qraumai and te/qrausmai (489 c), e)qrau/sqhn. (Attic) LSJ

qru/p-tw (qruf-, 125 g and N.) crush, weaken: te/qrummai, e)qru/fqhn Aristotle, 2 aor. pass. e)tru/fhn Hom., e)/n-qruptos. qru/ptomai put on airs. (II.)
(Attic) LSJ
qrw/|-skw and qrw/-skw (qrw-, qor-, 492) leap: -qorou=mai (806; W. u(pe/r) poetic, 2 aor. e)/qoron. Mainly poetic. By-form qornu/omai Hdt. (V.) LSJ
qu_/w (qu-, qu_-, 500. 1 a) sacrifice: qu_/sw, e)/qu_sa, te/quka, te/qumai, e)tu/qhn, qute/os. (Attic) LSJ
qu_/w and qu_/nw rush poetic: in the classical language only pres. and imperf. qu_ne/w Hesiod. LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with i
div2.p: i)ai/nw (i)an-) warm: i_)/hna, i)a/nqhn without augm. Epic and Lyric. (III.) LSJ
i)a/llw (i)al-) and i(a/llw send: -ialw=, i)/hla without augm. Epic. Poetic (comp. with e)pi/ in Aristoph.). (III.) LSJ

i)axe/w and i)a/xw (for vivaxw) sound, shout: i)axh/sw, i_)a/xhsa, 2 perf. part. a)mfiaxui=a. Hom. has both i_)/axon and i^)/axon. For i)a_x- in tragedy i)akx- is commonly written. Poetic, mainly Epic. 485 d. LSJ

i)d-, ei)d-, oi)d- (for vid-, etc.) in ei)=don saw from e)-vidon 431 (i)/dw, i)/doimi, i)de/, i)dei=n, i)dw/n), fut. ei)/somai shall know (Epic ei)dh/sw), plup. h)/|dh or h)/|dein knew (794 ff.), i)ste/os. Mid. ei)/domai seem, resemble Epic, poetic, New Ion.: ei)sa/mhn and e)eisa/mhn, 2 aor. ei)do/mhn saw Epic, poetic, Hdt., pro-ide/sqai Thuc. oi)d- in oi)=da, 794 ff. (Attic) LSJ
i(dro/w sweat: i(drw/sw, i_(/drwsa. For the contraction to w instead of ou (i(drw=si, etc.) see 398. Epic i(drw/w, i(drw/ousa, etc. LSJ
i(dru_/w place (Epic i(dru^/w): often comp. W. kata/: -idru_/sw, -i_/dru_sa, -i_/dru_ka, i_(/dru_mai, i_(dru_/qhn (i(dru/nqhn Epic), i(dru_te/os. (Attic) LSJ
i_(/e-mai (vi_e-, cp. Lat. in-vi-tus) strive: usu. in comp., as par-i_/emai beg. The forms are like those from the mid. of i_(/hmi send (cp. 778). Epic aor. e)eisa/mhn and ei)sa/mhn. LSJ

i(/zw (for si-s(e)d-w, cp. sedeo) seat, usu. sit, mid. i(/zomai sit, classic only in pres. and imperf. Mainly Ionic and poetic. See kaqi/zw, kaqi/zomai, the usual forms in prose. See also e(/zomai, ka/qhmai sit. By-form i(za/nw seat, place. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

i_(/hmi (si-sh-mi) send: h(/sw, h(=ka, 2 aor. ei(=ton, etc., ei(=ka, ei(=mai, ei(/qhn, e(qh/somai, e(to/s, e(te/os (except pres. all forms in comp. in prose). For inflection and synopsis, see 777 ff. (Attic) LSJ

i(kne/omai (i(k-) come, in prose usu. a)f-ikne/omai: a)f-i/comai, 2 aor. a)f-i_ko/mhn, a)f-i=gmai. Uncomp. i(knou/menos suitable (rare). The simple forms i(kne/omai, i(/comai, i_(ko/mhn are poetic. Connected forms are poetic i_(/kw (imperf. i(=kon, aor. i(=con) and i(ka_/nw, only pres. and imperf. (Epic and Tragic). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
i_(la/-sko-mai (i_(la-) propitiate: i_(la/somai, i_(lasa/mhn, i_(la/sqhn (489 e). Epic aor. i_(lassa/mhn, Epic pres. also i(la/omai. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
i_(/lhmi (i_(lh-, i_(la- for si-slh-, si-sla-) am propitious: pres. imper. i_(/lhqi or i_(/laqi, perf. i_(/lhka. Mid. i(/lamai propitiate. Epic. LSJ
i)/llw (i)/llomai) roll: i)=la. See ei)le/w and ei)/lw. (III or IV.) LSJ
i(ma/ssw (i(mant-) lash: i(/mas(s)a Epic. (III.) LSJ
i_(mei/rw (i_(mer-) and i_(mei/romai desire: i_(meira/mhn Epic, i_(me/rqhn Hdt., i_(merto/s. Poetic and Ion. (III.) LSJ
i(/ptamai fly: (725, 726 a): see pe/tomai. (Attic) LSJ
i)/sa_mi: Doric for oi)=da know: i)/sa|s (or i)/sais), i)/sa_ti, i)/samen, i)/sate, i)/santi, part. i)/sa_s. (Attic) LSJ
i)/skw liken ( = vik-skw): see e)i+/skw. LSJ

i(/sthmi (sth-, sta-) set, place: sth/sw shall set, e)/sthsa set, caused to stand, 2 aor. e)/sthn stood, 1 perf. e(/sthka stand ( = se-sthka), plup. ei(sth/kh stood (e(sth/kh, rare, 444 b), 2 perf. e(/staton stand (417), perf. mid. e(/stamai rare,
fut. perf. e(sth/cw shall stand (754 a, 1958), aor. pass. e)sta/qhn was set, v. a. stato/s, -te/os. For the inflection see 416, for dialectal forms of present see 747 D. ff. Epic 1 aor. 3 pl. e)/stasan and e)/sthsan, 2 aor. 3 pl. e)/stan (inf. sth/menai), 2 perf. inf. e(sta/men and e(sta/menai, part. e(staw/s and e(stew/s. Iterat. imperf. i(/staske, 2 aor. sta/ske (495 a). 819. (Attic) LSJ
i)sxnai/nw (i)sxnan-) make dry or lean: -isxnanw= (-ou=mai), i_)/sxna_na Aesch. (544 a, i_)/sxnhna Ion., also Att. ?), i_)sxna/nqhn Hippocr., -isxante/os Aristotle. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
i)/sxw (for si-s(e)x-w), have, hold: see e)/xw. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with k
div2.p: kad- (kade-) in Hom. kekadw/n depriving, kekadh/sw shall deprive. Not the same as kad-(kh/dw). kekado/mhn withdrew may be from xa/zw. LSJ
kaqai/rw (kaqar-) purify: kaqarw=, e)ka/qhra (and e)ka/qa_ra?), keka/qarmai, e)kaqa/rqhn, kaqarte/os Hippocr. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
kaqe/zomai: see e(/zomai. (Attic) LSJ
kaqeu/dw sleep: see eu(/dw. (Attic) LSJ
ka/qhmai: see 790. (Attic) LSJ

kaqi/zw set, sit: imperf. e)ka/qizon (450), fut. kaqiw= (539), aor. e)ka/qisa or kaqi=sa. Mid. kaqi/zomai sit: e)kaqizo/mhn, kaqizh/somai (521), e)kaqisa/mhn. Hom. has imperf. ka/qizon or kaqi=zon, aor. kaqei=sa and ka/qisa, Hdt. katei=sa. See i(/zw, e(/zomai. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
kai/-numai excel: perf. ke/kasmai (kekadme/nos Pind.). Poetic. (IV.) LSJ
kai/nw (kan-, kon-) kill: kanw=, 2 aor. e)/kanon, 2 perf. ke/kona (kata-kekono/tes Xen.). Poetic. (III.) LSJ

kai/w (for kaivw from kav-&iglide;w; kan-, kav-, kai-) and ka_/w (uncontracted, 396) burn, often W. e)n, kata/: kau/sw, e(/kansa, -ke/kauka, ke/kaumai, e)kau/qhn, -kauqh/somai, -kauto/s. 2 aor. e)/kha Epic, poetic (part. kh/a_s Epic, ke/a_s Att.), 2 aor. pass. e)ka/hn burned (intrans.) Epic and Ion. The MSS. show kai/w in tragedy, Thuc., and in Xen. usu., ka_/w in Aristoph., Isocr., Plato. 520. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

kale/w (kale-, klh-) call: kalw= (539 a), e)ka/lesa, ke/klhka, ke/klhmai am called (opt. 711 c), e)klh/qhn, fut. pass. klhqh/somai (kalou=mai S. El. 971), fut. perf. keklh/somai shall bear the name, klhto/s, -te/os. Aeolic pres. ka/lhmi, Epic inf. kalh/menai; fut. kale/w/ Hom., kale/sw Aristotle, aor. e)ka/lessa Hom. Iterative kale/eskon, kale/sketo. Epic pres. ki-klh/-skw. (Attic) LSJ
kalu/p-tw (kalub-) cover (in prose usu. in comp. W. a)po/, e)n, etc.): kalu/yw, e)ka/luya, keka/lummai, e)kalu/fqhn, kalupto/s, sug-kalupte/os poetic. (II.) (Attic) LSJ

ka/m-nw (kam-, kmh-) labor, am weary or sick: kamou=mai (806), 2 aor. e)/kamon, ke/kmhka, a)po-kmhte/os. Epic 2 aor. subj. also keka/mw, 2 aor. mid. e)kamo/mhn, 2 perf. part. kekmhw/s. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
ka/mp-tw (kamp-) bend: ka/myw, e)/kamya, ke/kammai, e)ka/mfqhn, kampto/s. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
kathgore/w accuse: regular. For augment, see 454. (Attic) LSJ
kaf-e- pant, in Epic 2 perf. part. kekafhw/s. LSJ
keda/n-nu_mi: see skeda/nnu_mi. (Attic) LSJ
kei=-mai lie: kei/somai. See 791. (Attic) LSJ
kei/rw (ker-, kar-) whear: kerw=, e)/keira, ke/karmai, a)po-karte/os Comic. Epic aor. e)/kersa (544 b), aor. pass. e)ke/rqhn Pind., 2 aor. pass. e)ka/rhn (Hdt.) prob. Att. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
kei/w split: Epic kei/wn c 425. LSJ
kei/w and ke/w wish to lie down. Epic. Cp. kei=mai. (Attic) LSJ

kelade/w roar: keladh/sw, kela/dhsa. By-form Hom. kela/dw in pres. part. Epic and Lyric.
LSJ
keleu/w command: keleu/sw, e)ke/leusa, keke/leuka, keke/leusmai (489 c), e)keleu/sqhn, para-keleusto/s, dia-keleuste/os. (Attic) LSJ
ke/llw (kel-) land: ke/lsw (536), e)/kelsa. Poetic = Att. o)ke/llw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ke/lomai (kel-, kele-, kl-) command: kelh/somai, e)kelhsa/mhn, 2 aor. e)keklo/mhn (448 D., 549 D.). Poetic = Att. keleu/w. (Attic) LSJ
kente/w (kent-, kente-, 485) goad: kenth/sw, e)ke/nthsa, keke/nthmai Hippocr., e)kenth/qhn late Att., sug-kenthqh/somai Hdt., kesto/s Hom., aor. inf. ke/nsai Hom. for kentsai. Poetic and New Ion. LSJ

kera/n-nu_mi and keran-nu/w (kera_, kra_-) mix: e)ke/rasa, ke/kra_mai, e)kra_/qhn and e)kera/sqhn (489 g), kra_te/os. Ion. are e)/krhsa (e)ke/rassa poetic), ke/krhmai, e)krh/qhn. By-forms kera/w and kerai/w, and ki/rnhmi and kirna/w. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
kerdai/nw (kerd-, kerde-, kerdan-) gain: kerdanw=, e)ke/rda_na (544 a), pros-keke/rdhka. Hdt. has fut. kerdh/somai, aor. e)ke/rdhna and e)ke/rdhsa (523 h). (III. IV.) (Attic) LSJ

keu/qw (kenq-, kuq-) hide: keu/sw, e)/keusa, Epic 2 aor. e)/kuqon and redupl. 2 aor. in subj. keku/qw, 2 perf. ke/keuqa as pres. (in Trag. also am hidden, and so keu/qw in trag.). Epic by-form kenqa/nw. Poetic. LSJ
kh/dw (khd-, khde-, kad-) distress: khdh/sw, e)kh/dhsa, 2 perf. ke/khda as pres., sorrow. Poetic. Mid. kh/domai am concerned: kekadh/somai Hom., e)khdesa/mhn Aesch. (Attic) LSJ
khru_/ttw (khru_k-) proclaim: khru/cw (147 c), e)kh/ruca, e)pi-kekh/ru_xa, kekh/ru_gmai, e)khru_/xqhn, fut. pass. khru_xqh/somai and (Eur.) khru/comai (809). (III.) (Attic) LSJ

ki-g-x-a/nw (kix-, kixe-), Epic kixa_/nw, come upon, reach, find: kixh/somai (806), 2 aor. e)/kixon, Epic e)kixhsa/mhn, a)-ki/xhtos. Hom. has 2 aor. pass. e)ki/xhn as intrans.: kixh/w (MSS. -ei/w), kixei/hn, kixh=nai and k:ixh/menai, kixei/s and (mid.) kixh/menos. These forms may come from a pres. ki/xhmi (688), but they all have aoristic force. Poetic. (IV.) LSJ
ki/d-nhmi: see skeda/nnu_mi. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
ki_/-numai move myself. Pres. and imperf. Epic. Att. ki_ne/w. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
ki/r-nhmi and kirnw/w Epic: see kera/nnu_mi. (Attic) LSJ
ki/-xrh-mi (xrh-, xra-) lend: e)/xrhsa, ke/xrhka, ke/xrhmai. Fut. xrh/sw Hdt., probably also Att. Mid. borrow: e)xrhsa/mhn. (Attic) LSJ

kla/zw (klagg-, klag-, 510) resound, clang: kla/gcw, e)/klagca, 2 aor. e)/klagon, 2 perf. ke/klagga as pres., fut. perf. kekla/gcomai as fut. shall scream (581, 806). Epic 2 perf. keklh/gontes (557 D. 2, 700 D.). By-form klagga/nw. Mainly poetic. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

klai/w weep (for klaivw from klav-&iglide;w: klau-, klav-, klai-, klaie-), kla_/w in prose (not contracted, 520): klaih/sw or kla_h/sw (klau/somai shall suffer for it), e)/klausa. Poetic are klausou=mai (540), ke/klaumai, ke/klausmai, klauto/s, klausto/s (?). The MSS. have klai/w in Xen. usu., kla_/w in Aristoph. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
kla/w break, in prose W. a)na/, a)po/, e)pi/, kata/, pro/s, su/n: -e/klasa (488 a), -ke/klasmai (489 c), -ekla/sqhn, a)na-klasqh/somai Aristotle. (Attic) LSJ

klei/w shut (Older Att. klh/|w): klei/sw and klh/|sw, e)/kleisa and e)/klh|sa, a)poke/klh|ka, ke/kleimai and ke/klh|mai (ke/kleismai has some support), e)klei/sqhn and e)klh/|sqhn (489 e), kleisto/s and klh|sto/s. klhi+/w is Ion. (Attic) LSJ
kle/p-tw (klep-, klop-) steal: kle/yw (less often kle/yomai), e)/kleya, ke/klofa, ke/klemmai, 2 aor. pass. e)kla/phn, klepto/s, -te/os. 1 aor. pass. e)kle/fqhn Ion. and poetic. (II.) (Attic) LSJ

klh/|zw celebrate in song: klh/|sw, e)/klh|sa (Dor. e)kle/i+ca from klei+/zw). Poetic. 512. (III.)
LSJ

kli_/nw (kli-n-) bend, usu. comp. W. kata/: -klinw=, e)/kli_na, ke/klika late, ke/klimai (491), 2 aor. pass. -ekli/nhn, 2 fut. pass. -klinh/somai, 1 aor. pass. e)kli/qhn poetic, e)kli/nqhn Epic, poetic, a)po-klite/os Aristotle. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

klu/w hear: imperf. e)/kluon is an old 2 aor. from an assumed pres. kleu/w; 2 aor. imper., without thematic vowel, klu=qi and (Epic) ke/kluqi; perf. ke/kluka rare; part. klu/menos as adj. famous = kluto/s. Poetic. LSJ
knai/w scratch, usu. comp. W. dia/: -knai/sw Eur., -e/knaisa, -ke/knaika, -ke/knaismai (489 c), -eknai/sqhn, -knaisqh/somai. (Attic) LSJ
*kna/w (knw=) scrape (kna-, knh-) (on pres. contraction knh=|s, knh=|, etc. see 394, 641) often comp. W. kata/: knh/sw Hippocr., e)/knhsa, -ke/knhsmai (489 c), -eknh/sqhn. Cp. knai/w. (Attic) LSJ
koilai/nw (koil-an-) hollow: koilanw=, e)koi/la_na (544 a), kekoi/lasmai (489 h) and e)koila/nqhn Hippocr. (III. IV.) (Attic) LSJ
komi/zw (komid-) care for: komiw=, e)ko/misa, keko/mika, keko/mismai (usu. mid.), e)komi/sqhn, komisqh/somai, komiste/os. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

ko/p-tw (kop-) cut, usu. in comp. in prose: ko/yw, e)/koya, -ke/kofa (dia/, e)c, su/n, etc.), ke/kommai, 2 aor. pass. -eko/phn (a)po/, peri/), 2 fut. pass. -koph/somai, fut. perf. -keko/yomai, kopto/s. Hom. has 2 perf. part. kekopw/s. (II.) (Attic) LSJ

kore/n-nu_mi (kore- for kores-) satiate: fut. kore/w Hom., kore/sw Hdt., aor. e)ko/resa poetic, 2 perf. part. kekorhw/s satisfied Epic, perf. mid. keko/resmai (489 c) Xen., keko/rhmai Ion., poetic, aor. pass. e)kore/sqhn poetic (489 g) a)-ko/rhtos and a)-ko/re(s)tos insatiate, both poetic. Ion. and poetic, rare in prose. (IV.) LSJ
koru/ssw (koruq-) arm with the helmet, arm: act. only pres. and imperf. Hom. aor. part. korussa/menos, perf. part. kekoruqme/nos. Poetic, mostly Epic. (III.) LSJ
kote/w am angry: e)ko/etsa (-a/mhn) and kekothw/s Epic. LSJ
kra_/zw (kra_g-, krag-) cry out: 2 aor. e)/kragon, 2 perf. ke/kra_ga as pres. (imper. 698, 704 e), fut. perf. as fut. kekra_/comai shall cry out (581, 806). By-form krauga/zw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

krai/nw (kran-) accomplish: kranw=, e)/kra_na, perf. 3 s. and pl. ke/krantai, e)kra/nqhn, kranqh/somai, a)/-krantos. Epic by-form kraiai/nw (kra_ai/nw?): e)krh/hna (e)kra_/hna ?), perf. 3 s. kekra_/antai, plup. kekra_/anto, aor. pass. e)kra_/anqen Theocr., a)-kra_/antos. Poetic. (III.) LSJ

kre/ma-mai (krema-) hang, intrans., used as pass. of krema/nnu_mi. Pres. inflected as i(/stamai (subj. kre/mwmai, opt. kremai/mhn, 749 b, 750 b), kremh/somai. Cp. kri/mnhmi and krema/nnu_mi. (Attic) LSJ
krema/n-nu_mi (krema-, 729) hang, trans.: kremw=, e)kre/masa, e)krema/sqhn, kremasto/s. Mid. intrans. see kre/mamai. Fut. krema/sw Comic poets, kremo/w Epic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
kri/zw (krik- or krig-) creak: 2 aor. Epic kri/ke (v. 1. kri/ge), 2 perf. ke/kri_ga Aristoph. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
kri/m-nhmi (krim-nh-, krim-na-) often miswritten krh/mnhmi, hang, trans., rare in act. Mid. kri/mnamai am suspended = kre/mamai. Poetic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
kri_/nw (kri-n-) judge: krinw=, e)/kri_na, ke/krika (491), ke/krimai, e)kri/qhn (e)kri/nqhn Epic, 491), kriqh/somai (krinou=mai rarely pass., 809), krite/os, krito/s poetic. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
krou/w beat: krou/sw, e)/krousa, -ke/krouka, -ke/kroumai and -ke/krousmai (489 g), -ekrou/sqhn, krouste/os. (Attic) LSJ

kru/p-tw (kruf-) hide: kru/yw (prose W. a)po/, kata/), e)/kruya, ke/krummai (prose W. a)po/), e)kru/fqhn, krupto/s, krupte/os poetic. Poetic 2 aor. pass. e)kru/fhn is rare (Soph.), kekru/yomai Hippocr. (II.)
(Attic) LSJ

kta/omai acquire. kth/somai, e)kthsa/mhn, ke/kthmai (442 N.) possess (subj. kektw=mai, -h=|, -h=|tai, 709; opt. kekth/|mhn, -h=|o, -h=|to, 711; doubtful are kektw/|mhn, -w=|o, -w=|to); fut. perf. kekth/somai shall possess (581); e)kth/qhn pass.; kthto/s, -te/os. Aor. mid. e)kthsa/mhn usu. = have possessed. Ion. perf. mid. e)/kthmai (442 D.) and fut. perf. e)kth/somai shall possess (both in Plato). (Attic) LSJ

ktei/nw (kten-, kton-, kta-n-, 478, 480) kill, in prose usually comp. W. a)po/, in poetry W. kata/; a)po-ktei/nw: ktenw=, e)/kteina, 2 perf. a)p-e/ktona. Ion. fut. ktene/w (ktane/w from ktai/nw). Poetic 2 aor. e)/ktanon and e)/ktan (551 D.); subj. kte/wmen MSS. x 216, inf. kta/menai, part. kta_/s; mid. e)kta/mhn was killed (687). Epic aor. pass. e)kta/qhn. In Att. prose a)po-qnh/|skw is generally used as the pass. of a)po-ktei/nw. By-forms a)po-ktei/nu_mi and a)po-kteinu/w (sometimes written ktei/nnu_mi, -u/w, kti_/nnu_mi, -u/w, 733). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
kti/zw found: kti/sw, e)/ktisa, e)/ktismai Pind., e)kti/sqhn, e)u+/-ktitos poetic. Epic 2 aor. mid. part. kti/menos (kti-) as pass., founded. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ktupe/w (ktup-, ktupe-, 485) sound: e)ktu/phsa, 2 aor. e)/ktupon Hom. (546 D). Poetic. LSJ
ku_dai/nw (ku_d-an-) honor: e)ku_/dhna Epic. Hom. has also ku_da/nw and ku_dia/w. 523 h. (III. IV.) LSJ

kue/w (ku-, kue-, 485) am pregnant: e)ku/hsa conceived, keku/hka. Fut. kuh/sw Hippocr., aor. pass. e)p-ekuh/qhn Aristotle. Mid. bring forth. Connected forms are ku/w (usu. poetic): e)/ku_sa impregnated Aesch. (ku_same/nh being pregnant), caus. kui+/skw impregnate and conceive, kui+/skomai conceive. (Attic) LSJ

kuli/ndw and kulinde/w, later kuli_/w, roll: e)ku/li_sa, kata-keku/li_smai (489 c), e)kuli_/sqhn, e)k-kuli_sqh/somai, kuli_sto/s. From e)ku/li_sa (= e)kulindsa) the pres. kuli_/w was formed. Connected is kalinde/omai. (Attic) LSJ
ku-ne/-w (ku-) kiss: kunh/somai (?), e)/kusa. Poetic. pros-kune/w render homage to: pros-kunh/sw, pros-eku/nhsa (pros-e/kusa poetic). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
ku/p-tw (kuf-, cp. ku/bda; or ku_f-, cp. ku_fo/s) stoop: a)na-ku/yomai (806), e)/kuya, ke/ku_fa. If the verb-stem is ku_f- the u is long in all forms. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
kure/w (kur-, kure-, 485) meet, happen is regular (poetic and Ion.). ku_/rw (kur-) = kure/w is mainly poetic: ku/rsw (536), e)/kursa. (III.) LSJ
kwku_/w (500, 1. a) lament: kwku_/sw Aesch., kwku_/somai (806) Aristoph., e)kw/ku_sa poetic. LSJ
kwlu_/w hinder: regular, but (rare) fut. mid. kwlu_/somai as pass. (808) T. 1. 142. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with l
div2.p: la-g-x-a/nw (lax-, lhx-) obtain by lot: lh/comai (806), 2 aor. e)/laxon, 2 perf. ei)/lhxa (445), ei)/lhgmai, e)lh/xqhn, lhkte/os. Ion. fut. la/comai, Ion. 2 perf. le/logxa (also poetic). Hom. 2 aor. e)/llaxon (redupl. le/laxon made partaker). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
la/zomai and la/zumai (Epic and Ion.) = lamba/nw. (Attic) LSJ

la-m-b-a/nw (lab-, lhb-) take: lh/yomai (806), 2 aor. e)/labon, ei)/lhfa (445), ei)/lhmmai, e)lh/fqhn, lhfqh/somai, lhpto/s, -te/os. Fut. la/myomai (better la/yomai) Ion., la_you=mai Doric; 2 aor. inf. lelabe/sqai Hom.; perf. lela/bhka (labe-) Ion. and Doric; perf. mid. le/lhmmai poetic, le/lammai Ion.; aor. pass. e)la/mfqhn Ion., e)la_/fqhn Doric; v. a. kata-lampte/os Hdt. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
la/mpw shine: la/myw, e)/lamya, 2 perf. le/lampa poetic. (Attic) LSJ

la-n-q-a/nw (laq-, lhq-) escape the notice of, lie hid: lh/sw, 2 aor. e)/laqon, 2 perf. le/lhqa as pres., v. a. a)/-lastos poetic. Mid. in prose usu. e)pi-lanqa/nomai forget (lanqa/nomai poetic, rare in prose; lh/qomai poetic): e)pi-lh/somai, 2 aor
e)p-elaqo/mhn, perf. mid. e)pi-le/lhsmai. Hom. has 2 aor. le/laqon caused to forget and lelaqo/mhn forgot (448 D.), perf. mid. le/lasmai. lelh/somai is poetic. By-forms are lh/qw, -omai, chiefly poetic: e)/lhsa poetic; and lhqa/nw cause to forget Epic, poetic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
la/p-tw (lab- or laf-) lap, lick: pres. late: e)k-la/yomai Aristoph., e)c-e/laya Aristoph., le/lafa Aristoph. Fut. la/yw Hom. (II.) (Attic) LSJ

la/skw, for lak-skw, 526 d (lak-, lake-) speak: lakh/somai (806), 2 aor. e)/lakon (e)la/khsa rare), 2 perf. as pres. le/lhka Epic = le/la_ka Tragic (part. lela^kui=a Epic), 2 aor. mid. lelako/mhn Epic. Poetic verb. By-forms e)pi-lhke/w Epic, laka/zw Tragic. (V.) LSJ
la/w see: only part. la/wn and imperf. la/e. Epic. LSJ
*la/w (lw=) wish (la-, lh-): contr. lh=|s, lh=|, inf. lh=n. Doric verb. Also lei/w. Cp. 394. LSJ

le/gw say: le/cw, e)/leca, perf. ei)/rhka (see under ei)/rw), le/legmai, e)le/xqhn, fut. pass. lexqh/somai, fut. perf. lele/comai, lekte/os, -to/s poetic. Fut. mid. le/comai as pass. is poetic (809). dia-le/gomai discuss: dia-le/comai and dia-lexqh/somai (812), di-ei/legmai, di-ele/xqhn (di-ele/ghn Aristotle), dia-lekte/os. (Attic) LSJ

le/gw collect, count, usu. in comp. W. e)c or su/n: -le/cw, -e/leca, 2 perf. -ei/loxa (445), -ei/legmai and -le/legmai, 2 aor. pass. -ele/ghn (-ele/xqhn rare in Att.), fut. perf. -legh/somai, -lekte/os, lekto/s poetic. 2 aor. mid. e)le/gmhn i 335. (Attic) LSJ

lei/pw (leip-, loip-, lip-, 477 a) leave, often in comp. W. a)po/, kata/, u(po/, etc.: lei/yw, 2 aor. e)/lipon, 2 perf. le/loipa have left, have failed. lei/pomai mid. remain, pass. am left, am inferior: le/leimmai, e)lei/fqhn, fut. pass. leifqh/somai, fut. perf. lelei/yomai, leipte/os. Fut. mid. lei/yomai is rarely pass. (809). 2 aor. mid. e)limo/mhn in prose only in comp. (as pass. *l 693). By-form kata-limpa/nw. On the inflection of the 2 aor. see 384. (Attic) LSJ
leptu_/nw (leptun-) thin: e)le/ptu_na, lele/ptusmai (489 h), e)leptu/nqhn. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
le/pw (lep-, lap-) peel, usu. comp. W. a)po/, e)k: -le/yw, -e/leya, le/lammai (inscr.), -ela/phn. (Attic) LSJ
leu/w stone to death, usu. comp. W. kata/ in prose: -leu/sw, -e/leusa, -eleu/sqhn (489 e), -leusqh/somai. (Attic) LSJ

lex- lay to rest (cp. le/x-os bed): le/comai, e)/leca (e)leca/mhn went to rest, imper. le/ceo, 542 D.), 2 aor. athematic forms (688) e)/lekto went to rest, imper. le/co for lex-so, inf. kata-le/xqai for -lexsqai, part. kata-le/gmenos. Epic. LSJ
lh/qw: see lanqa/nw. (Attic) LSJ
li-lai/omai (la- for las-, 624 a) desire eagerly only pres. and imperf.; with perf. leli/hmai (lia-). Epic. Cp. la/w. (III.) LSJ
li/ssomai rarely li/tomai (lit-) supplicate: e)llisa/mhn Epic, 2 aor. e)lito/mhn Epic, polu/-llistos. Poetic, rare in prose. (III.) LSJ
lixma/w (and lixma/zw) lick: perf. part. lelixmo/tes Hesiod. Usually poetic. LSJ
loe/w (= lovew) wash: loe/ssomai, e)lo/e(s)sa, -a/mhn. Epic. See lou/w. (Attic) LSJ

lou/w wash loses u before a short vowel and then contracts (398 a): lou/w, lou/eis, lou/ei, lou=men, lou=te, lou=si, e)/loun, lou/somai (lou/sw late), e)/lousa, le/loumai, a)/-loutos. Hom. has lo/w, loe/w: loe/ssomai, lou=sa z 217, lo/essa (-ato), Hippocr. e)lou/qhn. (Attic) LSJ
lu_mai/nw (lu_man-) abuse: usu. lu_mai/nomai as act.: lu_manou=mai, e)lu_mhna/mhn, lelu_/masmai (usu. mid. 489 h), e)lu_ma/nqhn Tragic. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

lu_/w (lu-, lu_-) loose. lu_/sw, e)/lu_sa, le/luka, le/lumai, e)lu/qhn, luqh/somai, lelu_/somai,
luto/s, -te/os. Inflection p. 114. On 2 aor. mid. Epic e)lu/mhn as pass., see 688. On perf. opt. lelu=to, see 711 D. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with m
div2.p: mai/nw (man-, mhn-) madden, act. usu. poetic: e)/mhna, me/mhna am mad. Mid. mai/nomai rage: manou=mai Hdt., 2 aor. pass. e)ma/nhn. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

mai/omai (for ma(s)-&iglide;omai, 624 a) desire, strive: ma/ssomai, e)ma(s)sa/mhn, e)pi/-mastos. Epic. Connected are Aeol. ma/omai (mw=tai, opt. mw=|to, imper. mw=so) and maima/w, Epic, poetic. (III.) LSJ
ma-n-q-a/nw (maq-, maqe-) learn: maqh/somai (806), 2 aor. e)/maqon, mema/qhka, maqhto/s, -te/os. Hom. has 2 aor. e)/mmaqon (429 a, D.). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
marai/nw (maran-) cause to wither: e)ma/ra_na, e)mara/nqhn Hom. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ma/r-namai (mar-na-) fight: only in pres. and imperf., subj. ma/rnwmai (749 b), imper. ma/rnao. Poetic. (IV.) LSJ
ma/rp-tw (marp-) seize: ma/ryw, e)/marya, 2 aor. e)/marpon (?) and redupl. me/marpon (?) Epic, 2 perf. me/marpa Epic. Poetic. (II.) LSJ
ma/ttw (mag-) knead: ma/cw, e)/maca, me/maxa, me/magmai, 2 aor. pass. e)ma/ghn (prosema/xqhn Soph.). (III.) (Attic) LSJ

ma/xomai (max-, maxe-) fight: maxou=mai (539 b), e)maxesa/mhn, mema/xhmai, maxete/os. Pres. Hom. maxe/omai (part. maxeou/menos and maxeio/menos, fut. Hom. maxh/somai (-e/ssomai?) and maxe/omai, Hdt maxh/somai; aor. Epic e)maxes(s)a/mhn (v. l. -hsa/mhn), Hdt. e)maxesa/mhn; v. a. maxhto/s Hom., a)-ma/xetos Aesch. (Attic) LSJ
me/dw and mede/w rule (485 d). Epic and poetic. me/domai am concerned about. LSJ
mequ/-skw make drunk: e)me/qusa. mequ/skomai get drunk, e)mequ/sqhn got drunk (489 e). (V.) (Attic) LSJ
mequ/w am drunk: only pres. and imperf.; other tenses from the pass. of mequ/skw. (Attic) LSJ

mei/g-nu_mi (meig-, mig-) mix (often written mi_/gnu_mi), also meignu/w, and less com. mi/sgw (526 c): mei/cw, e)/meica, me/meigmai, e)mei/xqhn, a)na-meixqh/somai rare, 2 aor. pass. e)mi^/ghn, meikto/s, -te/os. The forms with ei are restored on the authority of inscr. Epic 2 fut. pass. migh/somai, Epic 2 aor. mid. e)/mikto (e)/meikto ?), poetic fut. perf. memei/comai. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
mei/romai (mer-, for smer-, mor-, mar-) obtain part in: 2 perf. e)/mmore (442 D.) has a share in. Epic. ei(/martai it is fated (from se-smar-tai, 445 a). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
me/llw (mell-, melle-) intend, augments W. e, rarely W. h (430): mellh/sw, e)me/llhsa, mellhte/os. (Attic) LSJ
