me/lw (mel-, mele-) care for, concern poetic: melh/sw poetic, melh/somai Epic, 2 perf. me/mhla Epic, meme/lhmai as pres. poetic (Epic me/m-b-letai, 130 D.), e)melh/qhn poetic. Impersonal: me/lei it is a care, melh/sei, e)me/lhse, meme/lhke, melhte/os. Prose e)pi-me/lomai or e)pi-mele/omai care for (the latter form is far more com. on Att. inscr. after 380 B.C.): e)pi-melh/somai, e)pi-meme/lhmai, e)p-emelh/qhn, e)pi-melhte/os. (Attic) LSJ

me/mona (men-, mon-, ma-) desire: 2 perf. as pres.; sing. me/monas, -one; otherwise mi-forms (705), as me/maton (573), me/mamen, -ate, -a/a_si, imper. mema/tw, part. mema_w/s and mema^w/s, memaui=a, inf. memone/nai Hdt. Epic, poetic. LSJ
me/mfomai blame: me/myomai, e)memya/mhn, e)me/mfqhn rare in prose, mempto/s. (Attic) LSJ
me/nw (men-, mene-) remain: menw=, e)/meina, meme/nhka (485 c), meneto/s, menete/os. Byform mi/-mn-w Epic and poetic. (Attic) LSJ

mer-mhri/zw ponder, devise: a)p-emermh/risa Aristoph., mermh/rica Epic. Poetic. 512. (III.)
LSJ
mh/domai devise: mh/somai, e)mhsa/mhn. Poetic. LSJ
mhka/omai (mhk-, mak-, 486 D.) bleat: pres. and imperf. not used; Hom. 2 aor. part. makw/n, 2 perf. part. memhkw/s, memakui=a, 2 plup. e)me/mhkon (557 D. 3). LSJ
mhtia/w (mhti-, 486 D., cp. mh=tis) plan: also mhtia/omai and (Pind.) mhti/omai: -i_/somai, -i_sa/mhn. Epic and Lyric. LSJ
miai/nw (mian-) stain: mianw=, e)mi/a_na, memi/asmai (489 h), e)mia/nqhn, mianqh/somai, a)-mi/antos poetic. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

mi-mnh/|-skw and mi-mnh/-skw (mna-, 526 b) remind, mid. remember. Act. usu. a)na- or u(po-mimnh/|skw (the simple is poetic except in pass.): -mnh/sw, -e/mnhsa, perf. me/mnhmai = pres. (442 N.) remember, e)mnh/sqhn (489 e) as mid. remembered, mentioned, fut. pass. = mid. mnhsqh/somai shall remember, fut. perf. memnh/somai shall bear in mind (581), v. a. e)pi-mnhste/os, a)/-mnastos Theocr. me/mnhmai has subj. memnw=mai (709), opt. memnh/|mhn (memnw/|mhn doubtful, 711 b), imper. me/mnhso (Hdt. me/mneo), inf. memnh=sqai, part. memnhme/nos. Fut. mnh/sw (-omai), aor. e)/mnhsa (-a/mhn) are poetic. Epic mna/omai in Hom. e)mnw/onto, mnwo/menos (643). (V.) (Attic) LSJ
mi/mnw remain: poetic for me/nw. (Attic) LSJ
mi/sgw (for mi-(m)sgw, 526 c) mix, pres. and imperf. See mei/gnu_mi. (Attic) LSJ
mu/zw suck, Ion. muze/w, late e)k-muza/w. Hom. e)k-muzh/sa_s squeezing out. LSJ
mu/zw (mug-) grumble: e)/muca. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
mu_ka/omai (mu^k-, mu_k-, mu_ka-, 486) bellow: e)mu_khsa/mhn, Epic 2 aor. mu/kon (546 D.), Epic 2 perf. me/mu_ka as pres. (Attic) LSJ
mu/ttw (muk-) wipe usu. comp. W. a)po/: -e/muca, -ememu/gmhn. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
mu/w shut the lips or eyes (u_ late, uncertain in Att.): e)/musa, me/mu_ka. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with n
div2.p: nai/w (nas-&iglide;w, 624 a) dwell: e)/nassa caused to dwell, e)nassa/mhn took up my abode and caused to dwell, e)na/sqhn was settled or dwelt. Poetic. (III.) LSJ
nai/w (nav-&iglide;w, 624 b) swim: nai=on i 222 (v. l. na=on). (III.) LSJ
na/ttw (nad-, nag-, 514 a, 515 b) compress: e)/naca Epic and Ion., ne/nasmai Aristoph. (ne/nagmai Hippocr.), nasto/s Aristoph. Mostly Ion. and poetic. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
na/w (nav-w) flow only in pres. Epic. Cp. nai/w swim. LSJ
*na/w (nw=) spin (na-, nh-, 394): pres. nh=|s, nh=|, nw=si, inf. nh=n, part. nw=n, fut. nh/sw, aor. e)/nhsa, aor. pass. e)nh/qhn. (Attic) LSJ
neike/w (neike- for neikes-; cp. to\ nei=kos strife) chide, usu. neikei/w in Hom.: neike/sw, e)nei/kes(s)a. Epic (also Hdt.). (III.) LSJ
nei/fei (neif-, nif-, 477; better form than ni_/fei) snows, covers with snow: kate/neiye. Pass. nei/fetai. (Attic) LSJ
ne/mw (nem-, neme-) distribute, mid. also go to pasture: nemw=, e)/neima, dia-nene/mhka, nene/mhmai, e)nemh/qhn, dia-nemhte/os. (Attic) LSJ
ne/omai (nes-) go, come, only in pres. and imperf.: usu. in fut. sense. Mainly poetic. Cp. ni_/somai. 541. LSJ
neu/w nod: -neu/somai W. a)na/ or kata/ (806), e)/neusa, ne/neuka. Hom. has fut. neu/sw and kata-neu/somai. (Attic) LSJ
ne/w (neu-, nev-, nu-, originally sneu-, etc.) swim, often comp. W. dia/, e)c: neusou=mai Xen. (540, 806), -e/neusa, -ne/neuka, neuste/os. Cp. nh/xomai. (Attic) LSJ
ne/w heap up, pres. in comp. and only in Hdt. (Att. usu. has xo/w): e)/nhsa, ne/nhmai (ne/nhsmai ? 489 g), nhto/s Hom. Epic nhe/w. (Attic) LSJ

ni/zw (nib-, nig-, 509 a) wash, in Att. usu. comp. W. a)po/, e)c: -ni/yomai (ni/yw poetic),
-e/niya, -ne/nimmai, -eni/fqhn Hippocr., a)/-niptos Hom. = a)n-apo/-niptos. ni/ptw is late, ni/ptomai Hom. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ni_/somai go or will go: from ni-n(e)s-&iglide;omai, cp. no/s-tos return. Often printed ni/ssomai (MSS. often have nei/somai). Poetic. (III.) LSJ
noe/w think, perceive, regular in Att. Mid. noou=mai usu. in comp., fut. dia-noh/somai (rare) and dia-nohqh/somai (812). Ion. contracts oh to w in e)/nwsa, ne/nwka, ne/nwmai. (Attic) LSJ
nomi/zw believe: nomiw= (539 e), e)no/misa, neno/mika, neno/mismai, e)nomi/sqhn, nomisqh/somai, nomiste/os. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with c
div2.p: cai/nw (can-) scratch: canw=, e)/chna, e)/cammai late Att., e)/casmai Hippocr. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
chrai/nw (chran-) dry: chranw=, e)ch/ra_na, e)ch/rasmai (489 h), e)chra/nqhn. Ion. e)ch/rhna, late e)ch/rammai. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
cu_/w polish: e)/cu_sa, e)cu/sqhn (489 c), e)/cusmai Aristotle, custo/s Hdt. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with o
div2.p: o(doipore/w travel: regular, but observe o(doipepo/rhka for w(doipo/rhka. See 453. (Attic) LSJ
o(dopoie/w make a way: regular, but w(dopepoihme/nos in Xen. for w(dopoihme/nos. 453. (Attic) LSJ
o)du- àm angry: in Hom. aor. w)dus(s)a/mhn, perf. o)dw/dustai as pres. (489 d). LSJ
o)/zw (o)d-, o)ze-) smell: o)zh/sw, w)/zhsa. Hippocr. o)ze/sw and w)/zesa, Epic plup. o)dw/dei as imperf., Aeolic o)/sdw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

oi)/gw open: oi)/cw, w)=|ca, oi)xqei/s Pind. Poetic, as is also oi)/gnu_mi. In prose a)n-oi/gw and a)n-oi/gnu_mi, q.v. The older form is o)ei/gw, found in Hom. aor. w)/eica (MSS. w)/i+ca). Hom. has also w)i+gnu/mhn (w)eig-?). (Attic) LSJ
oi)=da (oi)d-): see i)d- and 794. (Attic) LSJ
oi)de/w swell: w)/|dhsa, w)/|dhka. By-form oi)da/nw poetic. (Attic) LSJ
oi)kti_/rw (oi)ktir-, 620. iii) pity: w)/|kti_ra. oi)ktei/rw is a late spelling. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
oi)mw/zw lament: oi)mw/comai (806), w)/|mwca, oi)/mwgmai (?) Eur., w)|mw/xqhn poetic. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
oi)noxoe/w and -xoeu/w Hom. pour wine: imperf. oi)noxo/ei, w)|noxo/ei (e)w|noxo/ei, *d 3, is incorrect for e)voin-), oi)noxoh/sw, oi)noxoh=sai. Epic and Lyric, and in Xen. (Attic) LSJ

oi)/omai (oi)-, oi)e-) think: 1 pers. in prose usu. oi)=mai: imperf. w)/|mhn (rarely w)|o/mhn), oi)h/somai, w)|h/qhn, oi)hte/os. Epic o)i+/w, o)i_/w, and oi)/w, o)i_/omai (500. 2. D.), o)i_sa/mhn, w)i+/sqhn (489 e). oi)=mai is probably a perfect (634). (Attic) LSJ
oi)/sw: shall bear. See fe/rw. (Attic) LSJ

oi)/xomai (oi)x-, oi)xe-, oi)xo-, 486) am gone as perf. (1886): oi)xh/somai, oi)/xwka poetic and Ion. (some MSS. w)/|xwka), par-w/|xhka (?) K 252. oi)/xwka is probably due to Att. redupl. Ion. -oi/xhmai is doubtful. (Attic) LSJ
o)ke/llw (o)kel-) run ashore: w)/keila. Cp. ke/llw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
o)lisq-a/nw (o)lisq-) slip, also di-olisqai/nw: 2 aor. w)/lisqon Ion., poetic; di-wli/sqhsa and w)li/sqhka Hippocr. (o)lisqe-). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

o)/l-lu_mi destroy, ruin, lose, for o)l-nu_-mi (o)l-, o)le-, o)lo-) also -ollu/w, in prose usu. comp. W. a)po/, also W. dia/ or e)c: -olw= (539 b), -w/lesa, -olw/leka have ruined, 2 perf. -o/lwla am ruined. Fut. o)le/s(s)w Epic, o)le/sw rare in comedy, o)le/w Hdt. Mid. o)/llumai perish: -olou=mai, 2 aor. -wlo/mhn, part. o)lo/menos ruinous (ou)l- Epic). By-form o)le/kw Epic, poetic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
o)l-olu/zw (o)lolug-) shout, rare in prose: o)lolu/comai (806), w)lo/luca. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

o)lofu_/romai (o)lofur-) bewail: o)lofurou=mai, w)lofu_ra/mhn, w)lofu/rqhn made to lament Thuc. 3. 78. (III.)
(Attic) LSJ

o)/m-nu_mi (o)m-, o)mo-, 486) and o)mnu/w swear: o)mou=mai (806) for o)mosomai, w)/mosa, o)mw/moka, o)mw/momai and o)mw/mosmai (489 g), w)mo/qhn and w)mo/sqhn, o)mosqh/somai, a)p-w/motos. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
o)mo/rg-nu_mi (o)morg-) wipe, usu. comp. W. e)c in poetry: -omo/rcw, w)/morca. e)c-omo/rgnumai: -omo/rcomai, -wmorca/mhn, -wmo/rxqhn. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

o)ni/-nh-mi (o)nh-, o)na-; for o)n-onh-mi, but the redupl. has no regard for the o) benefit: o)nh/sw, w)/nhsa, 2 aor. mid. w)nh/mhn received benefit (opt. o)nai/mhn), w)nh/qhn, a)n-o/nhtos. 2 aor. mid. imper. o)/nhso Hom., W. part. o)nh/menos Hom.; 1 aor. mid. w)na/mhn is late. (Attic) LSJ

o)/no-mai (o)no-, 725) insult: pres. and imperf. like di/domai, opt. o)/noito Hom.; o)no/ssomai, w)nos(s)a/mhn, aor. pass. subj. kat-onosqh=|s Hdt. (489 e), o)noto/s Pind., o)nosto/s Hom. w)/nato P 25 may be imperf. of a by-form o)/namai. LSJ
o)cu_/nw (o)cun-) sharpen, in prose par-ocu_/nw provoke: -ocunw=, w)/cu_na, -w/cummai, -wcu/nqhn. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
o)p- in fut. o)/yomai, perf. mid. w)=mmai, aor. pass. w)/fqhn, peri-opte/os. See o(ra/w. (Attic) LSJ
o)pui/w (o)pu-) take to wife (later o)pu_/w): o)pu_/sw Aristoph. Epic, poetic. (III.) LSJ

o(ra/w (o(ra- for vora-) see: imperf. e(w/rwn (434), fut. o)/yomai 806 (o)/yei 2 s.), 2 aor. ei)=don (i)d- for vid-), 1 perf. e(o/ra_ka (443) and e(w/ra_ka (plup. e(wra_/kh), e(w/ra_mai and w)=mmai, w)/fqhn, o)fqh/somai, o(ra_to/s, peri-opte/os. Aeolic o)/rhmi, Epic o(ro/w (643), New Ion. o(re/w. Imperf. w(/rwn Hdt., fut. e)p-o/yomai in Hom. = shall look on, e)pi-o/yomai shall choose, aor. mid. e)p-wya/mhn saw Pind., e)pi-wya/mhn chose Plato, 2 perf. o)/pwpa poetic, Ion. See i)d- and o)p-. (VI.) (Attic) LSJ
o)rgai/nw (o)rgan-) am angry: w)/rga_na (544 a) made angry. Tragic. 523 h. (III.) LSJ
o)rgi/zw enrage: e)c-orgiw=, w)/rgisa, w)/rgismai, w)rgi/sqhn, o)rgisqh/somai, o)rgiste/os. 512, 815. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

o)re/gw reach Epic, poetic, o)re/g-nu_mi Epic (only part. o)regnu_/s): o)re/cw, w)/reca rare in prose. o)re/gomai stretch myself, desire: o)re/comai rare in prose, w)reca/mhn but usu. w)re/xqhn as mid., o)rekto/s Hom. Perf. w)/regmai Hippocr., o)rw/regmai (3 pl. o)rwre/xatai *p 834, plup. o)rwre/xato *l 26). By-form o)rigna/omai: w)rignh/qhn. (Attic) LSJ

o)/r-nu_mi (o)r-) raise, rouse: o)/rsw (536), w)=rsa, 2 aor. trans. and intrans. w)/roron Epic (448 D.), 2 perf. o)/rwra as mid. have roused myself, am roused. Mid. o)/rnumai rise, rush: fut. o)rou=mai Hom., 2 aor. w)ro/mhn (Epic are w)=rto, imper. o)/rso, o)/rseo (542 D.) and o)/rseu, inf. o)/rqai, part. o)/rmenos), perf. o)rw/remai Hom. Poetic. (IV.) LSJ

o)ru/ttw (o)rux-) dig, often comp. W. dia/, kata/: -oru/cw, w)/ruca, -orw/ruxa, o)rw/rugmai (w)/rugmai ?), w)ru/xqhn, -oruxqh/somai, 2 fut. pass. -oruxh/somai Aristoph., o)rukto/s. Mid. aor. w)ruca/mhn caused to dig Hdt. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
o)sfrai/nomai (o)sfran-, o)sfre-) smell: o)sfrh/somai, 2 aor. w)sfro/mhn, w)sfra/nqhn late Com. and Hippocr. Hdt. has w)sfra/mhn. 530. (III. IV.) (Attic) LSJ
o)totu/cw lament: o)totu/comai (806), w)to/tuca. 512. (III.) LSJ
ou)re/w make water: e)ou/roun, ou)rh/somai (806), e)n-eou/rhsa, e)n-eou/rhka. New Ion. has ou)r- for Att. e)our- (as ou)rh/qhn Hippocr.). (Attic) LSJ
ou)ta/zw wound: ou)ta/sw, ou)/tasa, ou)/tasmai. Epic and Tragic. 512. (III.) LSJ
ou)ta/w wound: ou)/thsa, 2 aor. (mi-form) 3 s. ou)=ta 551 D., 634, 688 (inf. ou)ta/menai and ou)ta/men), 2 aor. mid. ou)ta/menos as pass., a)n-ou/tatos. Epic and Tragic. LSJ

o)fei/lw (o)fel-, o)feile-) owe: o)feilh/sw, w)fei/lhsa, 2 aor. w)/felon in wishes, would that! w)fei/lhka, aor. pass. part. o)feilhqei/s. Hom. usu. has o)fe/llw, the Aeolic form. (III.)
(Attic) LSJ
o)fe/llw (o)fel- 519 a) increase: aor. opt. o)fe/lleie Hom. Poetic, mainly Epic. (III.) LSJ

o)fl-isk-a/nw (o)fl-, o)fle-, o)fl-isk-, 530): owe, am guilty, incur a penalty: o)flh/sw, w)/flhsa (rare and suspected), 2 aor. w)=flon, w)/flhka, w)/flhmai. For 2 aor. o)flei=n, o)flw/n MSS. often have o)/flein and o)/flwn, as if from o)/flw, a late present. (IV. V.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with p
div2.p: pai/zw (paid-, paig-) sport: e)/paisa, pe/paika, pe/paismai, paiste/os. Att. fut. prob. pai/somai (806). paicou=mai in Xen. S. 9. 2 is used by a Syracusan. (Attic) LSJ
pai/w (pai-, paie-) strike: pai/sw and paih/sw Aristoph., e)/paisa, u(per-pe/paika; for e)pai/sqhn Aesch. (489 e), Att. usu. has e)plh/ghn, as pe/plhgmai for pe/paika. (Attic) LSJ
palai/w wrestle: e)pa/laisa, e)palai/sqhn Eur. (489 e), palai/sw Epic, dus-pa/laistos Aesch. (Attic) LSJ
pa/llw (pal-) shake, brandish: e)/phla, pe/palmai. Hom. has 2 aor. redupl. a)m-pepalw/n and 2 aor. mid. (e)/)palto. Epic and poetic. (III.) LSJ

pa/omai (pa-) acquire, become master = kta/omai; pres. not used: pa_/somai, e)pa_sa/mhn, pe/pa_mai. Doric verb, used in poetry and in Xen. Distinguish pa^/somai, e)pa^sa/mhn from pate/omai eat. (Attic) LSJ
para-nome/w transgress the law augments par-enom- rather than par-hnom- though the latter has support (T. 3. 67. 5), perf. para-neno/mhka. See 454. (Attic) LSJ
par-oine/w insult (as a drunken man): e)par-w/|noun, e)par-w/|nhsa, pepar-w/|nhka, e)par-w|nh/qhn (best MS. parw|nh/qhn D. 22. 63). See 454. (Attic) LSJ

pa/sxw suffer (penq-, ponq-, paq-) for p(e)&nnull;q-skw (36 b, 526 d): pei/somai (806) for penq-somai, 2 aor. e)/paqon, 2 perf. pe/ponqa (Hom. pe/posqe or pe/pasqe 573, 705 and fem. part. pepaqui=a); Doric pe/posxa. (V. VI.) (Attic) LSJ
pata/ssw strike: pres. and imperf. Epic (for which Att. has tu/ptw and pai/w), pata/cw, e)pa/taca, e)k-pepa/tagmai Hom. (Att. pe/plhgmai), e)pata/xqhn late (Att. e)plh/ghn). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
pate/omai (pat-, pate-) eat, taste: pa^/somai (?) Aesch., e)pa^s(s)a/mhn Hom., plup. pepa/smhn Hom., a)/-pastos Hom. Mainly Epic, also New Ion. LSJ
pa/ttw (pat-, 515 a) sprinkle: usu. in comp. W. e)n, e)pi/, kata/: pa/sw, -e/pasa, -epa/sqhn, paste/os. Hom. has only pres. and imperf. Often in comedy. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

pau/w stop, cause to cease: pau/sw, e)/pausa, pe/pauka, pe/paumai, e)pau/qhn, pauqh/somai, fut. perf. pepau/somai (581), a)/-paustos, pauste/os. Mid. pau/omai cease: pau/somai, e)pausa/mhn. In Hdt. MSS. have e)pau/qhn and e)pau/sqhn. (Attic) LSJ

pei/qw (peiq-, poiq-, piq-) persuade: pei/sw, e)/peisa, pe/paika, 2 perf. pe/poiqa trust, pe/peismai, e)pei/sqhn, peisqh/somai, pisto/s, peiste/os. Mid. pei/qomai believe, obey: pei/somai. 2 aor. e)/piqon and e)piqo/mhn poetic; redupl. 2 aor. pe/piqon Epic, 448 D. (pepi/qw, -oimi); 2 plup. 1 pl. e)pe/piqmen (573) for e)pepoi/qamen; 2 perf. imper. pe/peisqi Aesch. Eum. 599 (pe/pisqi?). From piqe- come Hom. piqh/sw shall obey, pepiqh/sw shall persuade, piqh/sa_s trusting. (Attic) LSJ
peina/w (peina-, peinh-) hunger (for contraction in pres. see 394, 641): peinh/sw, e)pei/nhsa, pepai/nhka. Inf. pres. peinh/menai Hom. (Attic) LSJ
pei/rw (per-, par-) pierce, Epic in pres.: e)/peira, pe/parmai, 2 aor. pass. a)n-epa/rhn Hdt. Ion. and poetic. (III.) LSJ

pekt-e/-w (pek-, pekt-e-, 485) comb, shear = Epic pres. pei/kw: e)/peca Theocr., e)peca/mhn Hom., e)pe/xqhn Aristoph. For comb Att. usu. has kteni/zw, cai/nw; for shear kei/rw.
(Attic) LSJ

pela/zw (pe/las near) bring near, approach: pela/sw and Att. pelw= (538), e)pe/lasa (Epic also e)pe/lassa, and mid. e)pelasa/mhn), pe/plhmai Epic, e)pela/sqhn Epic (e)pla_/qhn in tragedy), 2 aor. mid. e)plh/mhn approached Epic (688), v. a. plasto/s. Poetic and Ion. Kindred are pela/w (pela-, pla-) poetic, pela/qw and pla_/qw dramatic, pi/lnamai and pilna/w Epic. Prose plhsia/zw (cp. plhsi/on). 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
pe/lw and pe/lomai (pel-, pl-) am (orig. turn, move myself): e)/pelon and e)pelo/mhn, 2 aor. e)/ple, e)/pleto, -plo/menos. Poetic. LSJ
pe/mpw (pemp-, pomp-) send: pe/myw, e)/pemya, 2 perf. pe/pomfa, pe/pemmai, e)pe/mfqhn, pemfqh/somai, pempto/s, pempte/os. (Attic) LSJ
peporei=n or peparei=n show: see por-. LSJ
pe/prwtai it is fated: see por-. LSJ
pe/rdomai (perd-, pord-, pard-) = Lat. pedo: a)po-pardh/somai, 2 aor. a)p-e/pardon, 2 perf. pe/porda. (Attic) LSJ
pe/rqw (perq-, praq-) sack, destroy: pe/rsw, e)/persa, 2 aor. e)/praqon, and e)praqo/mhn (as pass.). Inf. pe/rqai for perq-sqai (688). pe/rsomai is pass. in Hom. Poetic for prose porqe/w. (Attic) LSJ

pe/r-nhmi sell, mid. pe/rnamai: fut. pera/w, aor. e)pera/s(s)a, perf. mid. part. peperhme/nos. Poetic, mainly Epic, for pwle/w or a)podi/domai. Akin to pera/w (cp. pe/ra_n) go over, cross (pera_/sw, etc.); cp. pipra_/skw. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
pe/tamai fly: see pe/tomai. (Attic) LSJ

peta/n-nu_mi (peta-, pta-, 729) and petannu/w (rare) expand, in prose usu. comp. w. a)na/: -petw= (539), -epe/tasa, -pe/ptamai. Fut. e)k-peta/sw Eur., perf. mid. pepe/tasmai poetic (489 g), aor. pass. peta/sqhn Hom. (489 e). By-forms: poetic pi/tnhmi and pitna/w (only pres. and imperf.). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

pe/tomai (pet-, pete-, pt-) fly, in prose usu. comp. W. a)na/, e)c: -pth/somai (Aristoph. also peth/somai), 2 aor. -epto/mhn. Kindred is poetic pe/tamai: 2 aor. e)/pthn (poetic) and e)pta/mhn, inflected like e)pria/mhn (e)pta/mhn is often changed to e)pto/mhn), 687. Poetic forms are pota/omai and pote/omai (pepo/thmai, e)poth/qhn, pothto/s); pwta/omai is Epic. i(/ptamai is late. (Attic) LSJ
pe/ttw (pek-, pep-, 513 a) cook: pe/yw, e)/peya, pe/pemmai, e)pe/fqhn, pepto/s. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
peu/qomai (peuq-, puq-) learn, poetic for punqa/nomai. (Attic) LSJ
pe/fnon slew: see fen-. LSJ

ph/g-nu_mi (phg-, pag-) fix, make fast: ph/cw, e)/phca, 2 perf. pe/phga am fixed, 2 aor. pass. e)pa/ghn intrans., 2 fut. pass. pagh/somai. Epic 2 aor. 3 s. kate/phkto stuck (athematic, 736 D.), e)phca/mhn poetic and Ion., e)ph/xqhn and phkto/s poetic. phgnu/w rare (Hdt., Xen.). phgnu=to (Plato, Ph. 118 a) pres. opt. for phgnu-i-to (some MSS. phgnu/oito); cp. 819. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
phda/w leap, often comp. W. a)na/, ei)s, e)c, e)pi/: -phdh/somai (806), -eph/dhsa, -peph/dhka. (Attic) LSJ
pi_ai/nw (pi_an-) fatten: pi_anw=, e)pi_/a_na, kata-pepi_/asmai (489 h). Mostly poetic and Ion. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
pi/l-nhmi, pi/l-namai, pil-na/w, approach: see pela/zw. LSJ

pi/-m-plh-mi (plh-, pla-, 741; W. m inserted) fill. In prose comp. W. e)n (727): e)m-plh/sw, e)n-e/plhsa, e)m-pe/plhka, e)m-pe/plhsmai (489 c), e)n-eplh/sqhn, e)mplhsqh/somai, e)m-plhste/os. 2 aor. mid. athematic e)plh/mhn (poetic):
plh=to and plh=nto Epic, e)n-e/plhto Aristoph., opt. e)m-plh/|mhn Aristoph., imper. e)/mplhso Aristoph. By-forms: pimpla/nomai Hom., plh/qw am full poetic (2 perf. pe/plhqa) except in plh/qousa a)gora_/, plhqu/w abound, plhqu_/nomai Aesch., plhro/w. (Attic) LSJ

pi/-m-prh-mi (prh-, pra-, W. m inserted) burn. In prose usu. comp. W. e)n (cp. 727): -prh/sw, -e/prhsa, -pe/prhmai, -eprh/sqhn (489 e). Hdt. has e)m-pe/prhsmai, and e)m-prh/somai (as pass.) or e)m-peprh/somai (6. 9). pe/prhsmai Hdt., Aristotle. By-form e)m-prh/qw Hom. (Attic) LSJ
pinu/-skw (pinu-) make wise: e)pi/nussa. Poetic. (V.) LSJ

pi_/nw (pi-, po-, pw-) drink often comp. W. e)c or kata/: fut. pi_/omai 806 (usu. i_ after Hom., 541) and (rarely) piou=mai, 2 aor. e)/pion 548 a (imper. pi=qi, 687), pe/pwka, -pe/pomai, -epo/qhn, -poqh/somai, poto/s, pote/os, pisto/s poetic. Aeolic pw/nw. 529. (IV. VI.) (Attic) LSJ
pi-pi_/-skw (pi_-) give to drink: pi_/sw, e)/pi_sa. Poetic and New Ion. Cp. pi_/nw. 819. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

pi-pra_/-skw (pra_-) sell, pres. rare = Att. pwle/w, a)podi/domai: pe/pra_ka, pe/pra_mai, e)pra_/qhn, fut. perf. pepra_/somai, pra_to/s, -te/os. In Att. pwlh/sw, a)podw/somai, a)pedo/mhn are used for fut. and aor. (V.) (Attic) LSJ

pi_/-ptw (pet-, pt-, 36, ptw-) fall for pi-p(e)t-w: pesou=mai (540 c, 806), 2 aor. e)/peson (540 c), pe/ptwka. Fut. pese/omai Ion., 2 aor. e)/peton Doric and Aeolic, 2 perf. part. peptw/s Soph., pepthw/s and peptew/s Hom. (Attic) LSJ
pi/t-nhmi and pit-na/w spread out: poetic for peta/nnu_mi. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
pi/t-nw fall: poetic for pi_/ptw. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
pla/zw (plagg-, 510) cause to wander: e)/plagca. Mid. pla/zomai wander: pla/gcomai, e)pla/gxqhn wandered, plagkto/s. Poetic. (III.) LSJ
pla_/qw: dramatic for pela/zw, plhsia/zw. (Attic) LSJ
pla/ttw (plat-, 515 a) mould, form: e)/plasa, pe/plasmai, e)pla/sqhn, plasto/s. Fut. a)na-pla/sw Ion. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

ple/kw (plek-, plok-, plak-) weave, braid: e)/pleca, pe/plegmai, e)ple/xqhn rare, 2 aor. pass. -epla/khn (e)n, su/n), 2 perf. e)m-pe/ploxa Hippocr., probably Att., and e)m-pe/plexa Hippocr., fut. pass. e)m-plexqh/somai Aesch., plekto/s Aesch. (Attic) LSJ

ple/w (pleu-, plev-, plu-, 503, 607) sail (on the contraction see 397): pleu/somai or pleusou=mai (540, 806), e)/pleusa, pe/pleuka, pe/pleusmai (489 d), pleuste/os. e)pleu/sqhn is late. Epic is also plei/w, Ion. and poetic plw/w: plw/somai, e)/plwsa, 2 aor. e)/plwn (Epic, 688), pe/plwka, plwto/s. Att. by-form plw/|zw. (Attic) LSJ

plh/ttw (plhg-, plag-) strike, in prose often comp. W. e)c, e)pi/, kata/: -plh/cw, -e/plhca, 2 perf. pe/plhga, pe/plhgmai, 2 aor. pass. e)plh/ghn, but in comp. always -epla/ghn (e)c, kata/), 2 fut. pass. plhgh/somai and e)k-plagh/somai, fut. perf. peplh/comai, kata-plhkte/os. 2 aor. redupl. (e))pe/plhgon Hom., mid. peplh/geto Hom., e)plh/xqhn poetic and rare, -eplh/ghn Hom. Thuc. 4. 125 has e)k-plh/gnusqai (plh/gnu_mi). In pres., imperf., fut., and aor. act. Att. uses tu/ptw, pai/w for the simple verb, but allows the compounds e)kplh/ttw, e)piplh/ttw. In the perf. and pass. the simple verb is used. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
plu_/nw (plun-) wash: plunw=, e)/plu_na, pe/plumai (491), e)plu/qhn Ion. (prob. also Att.), plute/os, pluto/s Ion. Fut. mid. e)k-plunou=mai as pass. (808). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
plw/w sail: see ple/w. (Attic) LSJ

pne/w (pneu-, pnev-, pnu-, 503, 607) breathe, blow, often comp. W. a)na/, e)n, e)c, e)pi/, su/n:
pneusou=mai (540) and -pneu/somai (806), e)/pneusa, -pe/pneuka. Epic also pnei/w. From a)na-pne/w take breath: 2 aor. imper. a)/m-pnue X 222. See pnu_-. (Attic) LSJ
pni_/gw (pni_g-, pnig-) choke, usu. comp. W. a)po/: -pni/cw (147 c), -e/pnica, pe/pni_gmai, -epni/ghn, -pnigh/somai. (Attic) LSJ

pnu_- to be vigorous in mind or in body: Epic forms a)/m-pnu_to, a)m-pnu_/qhn (v. l. -pnu/nqhn), pe/pnu_mai am wise, pepnu_me/nos wise, plup. pe/pnu_so. Often referred to pne/w or pinu/skw. (Attic) LSJ
poqe/w desire, miss: poqh/sw or poqe/somai (806), e)po/qhsa or e)po/qesa (488 b). All other forms are late. (Attic) LSJ
pone/w labour, in early Greek pone/omai: regular, but pone/sw and e)po/nesa in MSS. of Hippocr.; Doric pona/w. (Attic) LSJ
por- (and prw-) give, allot: 2 aor. e)/poron poetic, 2 aor. inf. peporei=n (in some MSS. peparei=n) Pind. to show, perf. pass. pe/prwtai it is fated, h( peprwme/nh (ai)=sa) fate. Poetic. LSJ

pra_/ttw (pra_g-) do: pra_/cw, e)/pra_ca, 2 perf. pe/pra_xa (prob. late) have done, pe/pra_ga have fared (well or ill) and also have done, pe/pra_gmai, e)pra_/xqhn, fut. pass. pra_xqh/somai, fut. perf. pepra_/comai, pra_kte/os. Fut. mid. pra_/comai is rarely pass. (809). Ion. prh/ssw, prh/cw, etc. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
pra_u_+/nw (pra_u+n-) soothe: e)pra_/u_+na, e)pra_u+/nqhn. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
pre/pw am conspicuous: pre/yw poetic. Impersonal pre/pei, pre/yei, e)/preye. (Attic) LSJ
pria- buy, only 2 aor. mid. e)pria/mhn (p. 138). Other tenses from w)ne/omai. (Attic) LSJ
pri_/w saw: e)/pri_sa, pe/pri_smai (489 c), e)pri_/sqhn (Attic) LSJ
proi+/ssomai (proi+k-, cp. proi/c gift): pres. in simple only in Archilochus: fut. kata-proi/comai Aristoph. (Ion. kataproi+/comai). (III.) LSJ
ptai/w stumble: ptai/sw, e)/ptaisa, e)/ptaika, a)/-ptaistos. (Attic) LSJ
pta/r-numai (ptar-) sneeze: 2 aor. e)/ptaron; 1 aor. e)/ptara and 2 aor. pass. e)pta/rhn Aristotle. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

pth/ssw (pthk-, ptak-) cower: e)/pthca, e)/pthxa; 2 aor. part. kata-ptakw/n Aesch. From pta- Hom. has 2 aor. dual kata-pth/thn (688) and 2 perf. part. pepthw/s. Ion. and poetic also ptw/ssw (ptwk-). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
pti/ttw (ptis-) pound: e)/ptisa Hdt., peri-e/ptismai Aristoph., peri-epti/sqhn late Att. (489 c). Not found in classic prose. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ptu/ssw (ptux-) fold usu. comp. in prose W. a)na/, peri/: -ptu/cw, -e/ptuca, -e/ptugmai, -eptu/xqhn, 2 aor. pass. -eptu/ghn Hippocr., ptukto/s Ion. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ptu_/w (ptu-, ptu_-) spit: kat-e/ptusa, kata/-ptustos. Hippocr. has ptu/sw, e)ptu/sqhn. (Attic) LSJ

pu-n-q-a/nomai (peuq-, puq-) learn, inquire: peu/somai (for peuqsomai), peusou=mai A. Prom. 990, 2 aor. e)puqo/mhn, pe/pusmai, peuste/os, a)na/-pustos Hom. Hom. has 2 aor. opt. redupl. pepu/qoito. peu/qomai is poetic. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with r
div2.p: r(ai/nw (r(a-, r(an-, 523 h, perhaps for r(ad-n&iglide;w) sprinkle: r(anw=, e)/rra_na, e)/rrasmai, (489 h), e)rra/nqhn. Apparently from r(ad- come Epic aor. e)/rassa, Epic perf. e)rra/datai and plup. e)rra/dato. Perf. e)/rrantai Aesch. Ion., poetic. (III. IV.) LSJ
r(ai/w strike: r(ai/sw, e)/rraisa, e)rrai/sqhn (489 e). Fut. mid. as pass. dia-rrai/sesqai *w 355. Poetic, mainly Epic. LSJ
r(a/p-tw(r(af-) stitch: a)po-rra/yw, e)/rraya, e)/rramai, 2 aor. pass. e)rra/fhn, r(apto/s. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
r(a/ttw (r(ag-) throw down (late pres. for a)ra/ttw): cur-ra/cw, e)/rraca. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

r(e/zw (vreg-&iglide;w, 511) do: r(e/cw, e)/reca (less often e)/rreca), aor. pass. part. r(exqei/s, a)/-rektos. Poetic. Cp. e)/rdw. (III.)
LSJ

r(e/w (r(eu-, r(ev-, r(u-, and r(ue-) flow (on the contraction in Att. see 397): r(uh/somai 806 (2 fut. pass. as act.; r(eu/somai rare in Att.), e)rru/hn (2 aor.; pass. as act.; e)/rreusa rare in Att.), e)rru/hka, r(uto/s and r(euste/os poetic. r(eusou=mai Aristotle. (Attic) LSJ
r(h- stem of ei)/rhka, ei)/rhmai, e)rrh/qhn, r(hqh/somai, ei)rh/somai. See ei)/rw. (Attic) LSJ

r(h/g-nu_mi (r(hg-, for vrhg-, r(wg-, r(ag-) break, in prose mostly in comp. W. a)na/, dia/: -rh/cw, e)/rrhca, 2 perf. -e/rrwga am broken, 2 aor. pass. e)rra/ghn, 2 fut. pass. -ragh/somai; -e/rrhgmai and -errh/xqhn Ion., r(h:kto/s Hom. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
r(i_ge/w (r(i_g-, r(i_ge-, 485) shudder: r(i_gh/sw, e)rri_/ghsa and r(i_/ghsa, 2 perf. e)/rri_ga as pres. Chiefly poetic. LSJ
r(i_go/w shiver. On the contraction in the pres. see 398: r(i_gw/sw, e)rri_/gwsa. (Attic) LSJ

r(i_/ptw (r(i_p-, r(ip-) and r(i_p-t-e/w (485 d) throw: r(i_/yw, e)/rri_ya, 2 perf. e)/rri_fa, e)/rri_mmai, e)rri_/fqhn, 2 aor. pass. e)rri/fhn, fut. pass. a)po-rri_fqh/somai, r(i_pto/s Soph. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
r(ofe/w sup up: r(ofh/sw and r(ofh/somai (806), e)rro/fhsa. (Attic) LSJ

r(u_/omai (Epic also r(u/omai, rare in Att.) for vru_omai, defend: r(u_/somai, e)rru_sa/mhn, and r)usa/mhn O 29, r(u_to/s. Athematic forms are e)/r (r) u_to, 3 pl. r(u_/ato, r(u=sqai. See e)/ru_mai. Chiefly poetic. LSJ
r(upo/w soil: Epic perf. part. r(erupwme/nos (442 b. D.). Cp. r(upa/w am dirty. LSJ
r(w/n-nu_mi (r(w-) strengthen: e)p-e/rrwsa, e)/rrwmai (imper. e)/rrwso farewell, part. e)rrwme/nos strong), e)rrw/sqhn (489 e), a)/-rrwstos. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with s
div2.p: sai/nw (san-) fawn upon: e)/shna. Poetic, prob. also in prose. (III.) LSJ
sai/rw (shr-, sar-) sweep: 2 perf. se/shra grin: e)/shra Soph. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
salpi/zw (salpigg-) sound the trumpet: e)sa/lpigca (also e)sa/lpica?). (III.) (Attic) LSJ

sao/w (cp. savos safe) save: saw/sw, e)sa/wsa, e)saw/qhn. Epic and poetic (but not Att.). Epic pres. subj. so/h|s, so/h|, so/wsi, which editors change to saw=|s (sa/w|s, saoi=s, sow=|s), saw=| (sa/w|, saoi=, sow=|), saw=si (sa/wsi, so/wsi). For sa/w pres. imper. and 3 s. imperf. editors usu. read sa/ou (= sao-e), but some derive the form from Aeolic sa/wmi. Cp. sw/|zw. (Attic) LSJ
sa/ttw (sag-) pack, load: e(/saca, se/sagmai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
sa/w sift: e)/shsa, se/shsmai. New Ion. Here belong perf. e)/tthmai and diatta/w Att. for dia-ssa/w. LSJ

sbe/n-nu_mi (sbe- for sbes-, 523 f. N. 1) extinguish, usu. comp. W. a)po/ or kata/: sbe/sw, e)/sbesa, e)/sbhka intrans. have gone out, e)sbe/sqhn (489 c), 2 aor. pass. e)/sbhn intrans. went out (415, 756 a), sbh/somai, e)/sbesmai Aristotle. 819. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
se/bw revere, usu. se/bomai: aor. pass. as act. e)se/fqhn, septo/s Aesch. (Attic) LSJ
sei/w shake: sei/sw, e)/seisa, se/seika, se/seismai (489 c), e)sei/sqhn, seisto/s. (Attic) LSJ

seu/w (seu-, su-) urge, drive on, mid. rush: e)/sseua (543 a. D.) and seu=a, e)/ssumai as pres. hasten, e)s(s)u/qhn rushed, 2 aor. mid. e)s(s)u/mhn rushed (e)/ssuo, e)/ssuto or su/to, su/menos, 688), e)pi/-ssutos Aesch. Mostly poetic, esp. tragic. Here belongs a)p-essu/a_ (or a)p-e/ssoua) he is gone in Xen. Probably from soi/omai (so/os, sou=s motion), or from so/omai, come dramatic sou=mai (Doric sw=mai), sou=sqe (ind. and imper.), sou=ntai, sou=, sou/sqw. For seu=tai (S. Trach. 645), often regarded as from a form seu=mai, sou=tai may be read. LSJ

shmai/nw (shman-, cp. sh=ma sign) show: shmanw=, e)sh/mhna (e)sh/ma_na not good Att. though in MSS. of Xen.), sesh/masmai (489 h), e)shma/nqhn, e)pi-shmanqh/somai, a)-sh/mantos Hom., e)pi-shmante/os Aristotle. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

sh/pw (shp-, sap-) cause to rot: 2 perf. se/shpa am rotten, 2 aor. pass. e)sa/phn
rotted as intrans., 2 fut. pass. kata-saph/somai. sh/yw Aesch., se/shmmai Aristotle, shpto/s Aristotle. 819. (Attic) LSJ
si_ga/w am silent: si_gh/somai (806), e)si_/ghsa, sesi_/ghka, sesi_/ghmai, e)si_gh/qhn, si_ghqh/somai, fut. perf. sesi_gh/somai, si_ghte/os poetic. (Attic) LSJ
si_/nomai (sin-) injure, very rare in Att. prose: si_nh/somai (?) Hippocr., e)si_na/mhn Hdt. (III.) LSJ
siwpa/w am silent: siwph/somai (806), e)siw/phsa, sesiw/phka, e)siwph/qhn, siwphqh/somai, siwphte/os. (Attic) LSJ
ska/p-tw (skaf-) dig, often comp. W. kata/: ska/yw, -e/skaya, 2 perf. -e/skafa, e)/skammai, 2 aor. pass. -eska/fhn. (II.) (Attic) LSJ

skeda/n-nu_mi (skeda-), rarely skedannu/w, scatter, often comp. W. a)po/, dia/, kata/: -skedw= (539 c), -eske/dasa, e)ske/dasmai (489 c), e)skeda/sqhn, skedasto/s. Fut. skeda/sw poetic. By-forms: Epic keda/nnu_mi: e)ke/dassa, e)keda/sqhn; mainly poetic and Ion. ski/d-nhmi and ski/d-namai; poetic and Ion. ki/d-nhmi and ki/d-namai. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
ske/llw (skel-, sklh-) dry up: pres. late, Epic aor. e)/skhla (skal-; as if from ska/llw) made dry, 2 aor. intrans. a)p-e/sklhn (687) Aristoph., e)/sklhka am dried up Ion. and Doric. (III.) LSJ

ske/p-tomai (skep-) view: ske/yomai, e)skeya/mhn, e)/skemmai (sometimes pass.), fut. perf. e)ske/yomai, pass. skepte/os. For pres. and imperf. (Epic, poetic, and New Ion.) Att. gen. uses skopw=, e)sko/poun, skopou=mai, e)skopou/mhn. Aor. pass. e)ske/fqhn Hippocr. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
skh/p-tw (skhp-) prop, gen. comp. W. e)pi/ in prose: -skh/yw, -e/skhya, -e/skhmmai, -eskh/fqhn. By-form ski/mptw Pind., Hippocr. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
ski/d-nhmi (skid-nh-, skid-na-) ski/d-namai scatter: mainly poetic for skeda/nnu_mi. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
skope/w view: good Att. uses only pres. and imperf. act. and mid., other tenses are supplied from ske/ptomai. skoph/sw, etc., are post-classical. (Attic) LSJ
skw/p-tw (skwp-) jeer: skw/yomai (806), e)/skwya, e)skw/fqhn. (II.) (Attic) LSJ

*sma/w (smw=) smear (sma-, smh-, 394, 641) Ion., Comic: pres. smh=|s, smh=|, smh=tai, etc., e)/smhsa, e)smhsa/mhn Hdt. By-form smh/xw chiefly Ion.: e)/smhca, diesmh/xqhn (?) Aristoph., neo/-smhktos Hom. (Attic) LSJ
sou=mai hasten: see seu/w. LSJ
spei/rw (sper-, spar-) sow: sperw=, e)/speira, e)/sparmai, 2 aor. pass. e)spa/rhn, sparto/s Soph. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
spe/ndw pour libation, spe/ndomai make a treaty: kata-spei/sw (for spend-sw 100), e)/speisa, e)/speismai. (Attic) LSJ
spouda/zw am eager: spouda/somai (806), e)spou/dasa, e)spou/daka, e)spou/dasmai, spoudasto/s, -te/os. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
sta/zw (stag-) drop: e)/staca, e)n-e/stagmai, e)p-esta/xqhn, stakto/s. Fut. sta/sw late, staceu=mai Theocr. Ion. and poetic, rare in prose. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
stei/bw (steib-) tread, usu. only pres. and imperf.: kat-e/steiya, steipto/s. Poetic. From stibe-, or from a by-form stibe/w, comes e)sti/bhmai Soph. LSJ
stei/xw (steix-, stix-) go: peri-e/steica, 2 aor. e)/stixon. Poetic, Ion. LSJ
ste/llw (stel-, stal-) send, in prose often comp. W. a)po/ or e)pi/: stelw= poetic, e)/steila, -e/stalka, e)/stalmai, 2 aor. pass. e)sta/lhn, -stalh/somai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

stena/zw (stenag-) groan, often comp. W. a)na/: -stena/cw poetic, e)ste/naca, stena-
kto/s and -te/os poetic. By-forms: Epic and poetic stena/xw, Epic stenaxizw, poetic stonaxe/w, mainly Epic and poetic ste/nw. (Attic) LSJ
ste/rgw (sterg-, storg-) love: ste/rcw, e)/sterca, 2 perf. e)/storga Hdt., sterkti/os, sterkto/s Soph. (Attic) LSJ

stere/w (usu. a)po-stere/w in prose) deprive: sterh/sw, e)ste/rhsa, -este/rhka, e)ste/rhmai, e)sterh/qhn. Aor. e)ste/resa Epic, 2 aor. pass. e)ste/rhn poetic. Pres. mid. a)po-sterou=mai sometimes = am deprived of; sterh/somai may be fut. mid. or pass. (809). Connected forms: steri/skw deprive (rare in pres. except in mid.) and ste/romai have been deprived of, am without W. perf. force, 528, 1887. (Attic) LSJ
steu- in steu=tai, steu=ntai, steu=to affirm, pledge one's self, threaten. Poetic, mainly Epic. LSJ
sti/zw (stig-) prick: sti/cw, e)/stigmai. e)/stica Hdt., stikto/s Soph. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

sto/r-nu_mi (stor-, store-) spread out, in prose often W. kata/, para/, su/n, u(po/ (in prose usu. strw/nnu_mi): para-storw= Aristoph., e)sto/resa, kat-estore/sqhn Hippocr. (489 e). Fut. store/sw in late poetry (storesw= Theocr.). (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

stre/fw (stref-, strof-, straf-) turn, often in comp. in prose W. a)na/, a)po/, dia/, etc.: -stre/yw, e)/streya, e)/strammai, e)stre/fqhn (in prose only strefqw=, strefqei/s), usu. 2 aor. pass. as intrans. e)stra/fhn, a)na-strafh/somai, strepto/s. Prose has kat-estreya/mhn. 2 perf. a)n-e/strofa trans. is doubtful (Comic), aor. pass. e)stra/fqhn Doric, Ion. (Attic) LSJ
strw/n-nu_mi (strw-) spread out: u(po-strw/sw, e)/strwsa Tragic, Hdt., e)/strwmai, strwto/s poetic. Cp. sto/rnu_mi. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

stuge/w (stug-, stuge-, 485) hate: e)stu/ghsa (e)/stuca Hom. made hateful), 2 aor. kat-e/stugon Epic (546 D.), a)p-estu/ghka Hdt., e)stugh/qhn, fut. mid. stugh/somai as pass. (808), stughto/s. Ion. and poetic. LSJ
stufeli/zw (stufelig-) dash: e)stufe/lica. Mostly Epic and Hippocr. (III.) LSJ
su_ri/ttw (su_rigg-) pipe, whistle: e)su_/rica. By-form su_ri/zw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
su_/rw (sur-) draw, in comp. in prose esp. W. a)po/, dia/, e)pi/: -e/su_ra, -se/surka, -se/surmai and -surte/os Aristotle. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
sfa/llw (sfal-) trip up, deceive: sfalw=, e)/sfhla, e)/sfalmai, 2 aor. pass. e)sfa/lhn, sfalh/somai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

sfa/ttw (sfag-) slay, often in comp. W. a)po/, kata/: sfa/cw, e)/sfaca, e)/sfagmai, 2 aor. pass. -esfa/ghn, -sfagh/somai, e)sfa/xqhn Ion., poetic, sfakto/s poetic. By-form sfa/zw (so always in Trag.). 516. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
sxa/zw cut open, let go: a)po-sxa/sw, e)/sxasa Trag. (e)sxasa/mhn Comic), e)sxa/sqhn Hippocr. From sxa/w comes imperf. e)/sxwn Aristoph. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
sxeqei=n: see e)/xw. (Attic) LSJ

sw/|zw (sw- and swi-, sw=s safe), later sw/zw, save; many forms come from sao/w: sw/sw (from saw/sw) and sww= (Att. inscr.), e)/swsa (from e)sa/wsa W. recessive acc.) and e)/sw|sa (Att. inscr.), se/swka (from *sesa/wka) and se/sw|ka (?), se/swmai rare (from *sesa/wmai) and se/sw|smai (MSS. se/swsmai), e)sw/qhn (from e)saw/qhn), swqh/somai, sw|ste/os (MSS. swste/os). By-forms: Epic sw/w (cp. sw=s) and sao/w (cp. sa/os), q.v. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with t
div2.p: tag- seize: 2 aor. part. tetagw/n Hom. Cp. Lat. tango. LSJ

ta-nu/w (for t&nnull;-nuw, 35 b; cp. tei/nw from ten-) stretch, mid. ta/-numai (734): tanu/w (539 D.) and -tanu/sw (?), e)ta/nus(s)a, teta/nusmai, (489 c), e)tanu/sqhn; fut. pass. tanu/ssomai Lyric. Poetic, rare in New Ion. (IV.)
(Attic) LSJ
tara/ttw (tarax-) disturb: tara/cw, e)ta/raca, teta/ragmai, e)tara/xqhn, tara/comai as pass. (808). Epic 2 perf. intrans. te/trhxa am disturbed. Cp. qra_/ttw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ta/ttw (tag-) arrange: ta/cw, e)/taca, 2 perf. te/taxa, te/tagmai, e)ta/xqhn, e)pi-taxqh/somai, fut. perf. teta/comai, 2 aor. pass. e)ta/ghn (?) Eur., takto/s, -te/os. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
taf- (for qaf-, 125 g; cp. ta/fos and qa/mbos) astonish: 2 aor. e)/tafon poetic, 2 perf. te/qhpa am astonished Epic, Ion., plup. e)teqh/pea. LSJ
te/ggw wet: te/gcw, e)/tegca, e)te/gxqhn. Rare in prose. LSJ

tei/nw (ten-, ta- from t&nnull;-, 35 b) stretch, in prose usu. comp. W. a)na/, a)po/, dia/, e)c, para/, pro/, etc.; tenw=, -e/teina, -te/taka, te/tamai, -eta/qhn, -taqh/somai, -tate/os, tato/s Aristotle. Cp. tanu/w and titai/nw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
tekmai/romai (tekmar-) judge, infer: tekmarou=mai, e)tekmhra/mhn, tekmarto/s Comic, tekmarte/os Hippocr. Poetic tekmai/rw limit, show: e)te/kmhra. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

tele/w (tele- for teles-; cp. to\ te/los end) finish: telw=, e)te/lesa, tete/leka, tete/lesmai (489 c), e)tele/sqhn, e)pi-teleste/os. Fut. tele/sw rare in prose, a)po-telesqh/somai Aristotle. Epic also telei/w. (Attic) LSJ

te/llw (tel-, tal-) accomplish: e)/teila Pind. a)na-te/llw cause to rise, rise: a)n-e/teila; e)n-te/llomai (e)n-te/llw poetic) command: e)n-eteila/mhn, e)n-te/talmai; e)pi-te/llw enjoin, rise poetic: e)p-e/teila; e)p-ana-te/llw usu. rise, poetic and Ion. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
tem- (in tm-) find: Epic redupl. 2 aor. e)/tetmon and te/tmon. LSJ

te/m-nw (tem-, tam-, tmh-) cut: temw=, 2 aor. e)/temon, -te/tmhka (a)na/, a)po/), te/tmhmai, e)tmh/qhn, fut. perf. -tetmh/somai (a)po/, e)c), tmhte/os. ta/mnw Doric and Epic. te/mw Epic, 2 aor. e)/tamon, Doric, Ion., and poetic, tmhqh/somai Aristotle, tmhto/s poetic, Aristotle. Cp. also tmh/gw. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

te/rpw (terp-, tarp-, trap-) amuse: te/ryw, e)/terya, e)te/rfqhn (rare in prose) amused myself. Hom. 2 aor. mid. e)tarpo/mhn and redupl. tetarpo/mhn, Hom. aor. pass. e)ta/rfqhn and 2 aor. pass. e)ta/rphn (subj. traph/omen; MSS. tarpei/omen). All aor. forms in Hom. with a have the older meaning satisfy, satiate. (Attic) LSJ
tersai/nw (ters-an-, cp. torreo from torseo) dry: te/rshna trans. Epic. (III. IV.) LSJ
te/rsomai become dry. Mainly Epic. 2 aor. pass. e)te/rshn as intrans. became dry. LSJ
tetagw/n: see tag-. LSJ
teti/hmai Hom. perf.: see tie-. LSJ
te/tmon: see tem-. LSJ

te-trai/n-w (tetran-, and ter-, trh-) bore: e)te/tra_na and e)/trhsa, te/trhmai. Fut. dia-tetrane/w Hdt., aor. e)te/trhna Epic. By-form tore/w, q.v. Late presents ti/-trh-mi, ti-tra/-w. (III. IV.) (Attic) LSJ

teu/xw (teux-, tux-, tuk-) prepare, make (poetic): teu/cw, e)/teuca, 2 aor. te/tukon Hom., 2 aor. mid. tetuko/mhn Hom. (as if from * teu/kw), 2 perf. te/teuxa as pass. in teteuxw/s made M 423, te/tugmai often in Hom. = am (3 pl. teteu/xatai and plup. e)teteu/xato Hom.), fut. perf. teteu/comai Hom., aor. pass. e)tu/xqhn Hom. (e)teu/xqhn Hippocr.), v. a. tukto/s Hom. Hom. te/tugmai and e)tu/xqhn often mean happen, hit (cp. tetu/xhka, e)/tuxon from tugxa/nw). By-form ti-tu/skomai Epic. (Attic) LSJ

th= here! take! in Hom., often referred to ta- (cp. tei/nw, teneo), is prob. the instrumental case of the demonstr. stem to-. It was however regarded as a verb, and the pl. th=te formed by Sophron. LSJ

th/kw (thk-, tak-) melt: th/cw, e)/thca, 2 perf. te/thka am melted, 2 aor. pass, as intrans. e)ta/khn melted, thkto/s. Aor. pass. e)th/xqhn was melted rare.
(Attic) LSJ
tie-, in Hom. 2 perf. tetihw/s troubled, dual mid. teti/hsqon are troubled, mid. part. tetihme/nos. LSJ

ti/-qh-mi (qh-, qe-) place, put: qh/sw, e)/qhka (inflection 755), 2 aor. e)/qeton, etc. (756), te/qhka (762), te/qeimai (but usu. instead kei=mai, 767), e)te/qhn, teqh/somai, qeto/s, -te/os. For inflection see 416, for synopsis 419, for dialectal forms 747 ff. (Attic) LSJ
ti/ktw (for ti-tek-w; tek-, tok-) beget, bring forth: te/comai (806), 2 aor. e)/tekon, 2 perf. te/toka. Fut. te/cw poetic, tekou=mai rare and poetic, aor. pass. e)te/xqhn poetic (late). (Attic) LSJ
ti/llw (til-) pluck: tilw=, e)/ti_la, te/tilmai, e)ti/lqhn. Mostly poetic. (III.) LSJ
tina/ssw swing: often W. dia/: tina/cw (-tina/comai reflex. or pass.), e)ti/naca, teti/nagmai, e)tina/xqhn. Mostly poetic. (III.) LSJ

ti/nw (tei-, ti-) pay, expiate, often comp. W. a)po/, e)c: mid. (poetic) take payment, avenge: tei/sw, e)/teisa, te/teika, -te/teismai (489 c), -etei/sqhn, a)po-teiste/os (Hom. a)/-ti_tos unpaid). The spelling with ei is introduced on the authority of inscriptions; the MSS. have ti_/sw, etc. Hom. has ti_/nw from *ti/nvw, also ti/w. Poetic and Ion. Connected is tei/-numai (MSS. ti-) avenge myself: tei/somai, e)teisa/mhn (rare in Att. prose). Cp. ti/w. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
ti-tai/nw (titan-, i.e. tan- redupl.) stretch: e)ti/thna Hom. Cp. tei/nw. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
ti-trw/-skw (trw-) wound: trw/sw (W. kata/ in prose), e)/trwsa, te/trwmai, e)trw/qhn, trwqh/somai (trw/somai as pass. M 66), trwto/s Hom. Epic trw/w is rare. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
ti/w and ti_/w (tei/w?) honour: ti_/sw, e)/ti_sa (pro-ti_/sa_s S. Ant. 22), te/ti_mai, a)/-titos. Mainly Epic. In the pres. Att. has i^, Hom. i_ or i^. Cp. ti/nw. (Attic) LSJ

tla-, tlh-, tala- endure: tlh/somai (806), e)ta/lassa Epic, 2 aor. e)/tlhn (687), te/tlhka usu. as pres., 2 perf. (athematic) te/tlamen, etc. (705), tlhto/s. Poetic, rare in prose, which uses tolma/w. (Attic) LSJ
tmh/gw (tmhg-, tmag-) cut: tmh/cw, e)/tmhca, 2 aor. di-e/tmagon, 2 aor. pass. e)tma/ghn. Poetic for te/mnw. (Attic) LSJ
tore/w (tor-, tore-, 485) pierce: torh/sw, and (redupl.) tetorh/sw utter in a piercing tone Aristoph., e)to/rhsa, 2 aor. e)/toron. Cp. tetrai/nw. Mainly Epic. (Attic) LSJ
tot- hit, find in e)p-e/tosse Pind. LSJ

tre/pw (trep-, trop-, trap-), turn, mid. flee: tre/yw, e)/treya, mid. e)treya/mhn usu. put to flight, 2 aor. mid. e)trapo/mhn turned or fled (intrans. or reflex.; rarely pass.), 2 perf. te/trofa (and te/trafa?, rare), te/trammai, e)tre/fqhn fled or was turned (rare in Att.), 2 aor. pass. e)tra/phn usu. intrans., trepte/os, trepto/s Aristotle. In Att. e)trapo/mhn was gen. displaced by e)tra/phn. tra/pw New Ion., Doric, 2 aor. e)/trapon Epic and poetic, aor. pass. e)tra/fqhn Hom., Hdt. tre/pw has six aorists. Cp. 554 c, 595, 596. Hom. has also trape/w and trope/w. (Attic) LSJ

tre/fw (tref-, trof-, traf-; for qref-, etc., 125 g) support, nourish: qre/yw, e)/qreya, 2 perf. te/trofa, te/qrammai, e)qre/fqhn very rare in Att. prose, usu. 2 aor. pass. e)tra/fhn, trafh/somai, qrepte/os. Fut. mid. qre/yomai often pass. (808). tra/fw Doric, 2 aor. Epic e)/trafon grew up, was nourished. Cp. 595. (Attic) LSJ

tre/xw (trex- from qrex-, 125 g, and dram-) run: dramou=mai (806), 2 aor. e)/dramon, -dedra/mhka (kata/, peri/, su/n), e)pi-dedra/mhmai, peri-qrekte/os. tra/xw Doric, a)po-qre/comai Aristoph., e)/qreca rare and poetic, 2 perf. -de/droma (a)na/, e)pi/) poetic. Poetic drama/w. (VI.) (Attic) LSJ
tre/w (tre- for tres-; cp. Lat. terreo for terseo) tremble: e)/tresa (488 a), a)/-trestos poetic. Rare in prose. (Attic) LSJ

tri_/bw (tri_b-, trib-) rub: tri_/yw, e)/tri_ya, 2 perf. te/trifa, te/tri_mmai, e)tri_/fqhn, but
usu. 2 aor. pass. e)tri/bhn, -tribh/somai (e)c, kata/), fut. perf. e)pi-tetri_/yomai, a)/-triptos Hom. Fut. mid. tri_/yomai also as pass. (808). (Attic) LSJ
tri/zw (trig-, tri_g-) squeak, chirp: 2 perf. te/tri_ga as pres. (part. tetri_gw=tes, tetri_gui=a, Hom.). Ion. and poetic. (III.) LSJ

tru_xo/w exhaust, waste: pres. poet. and rare, usu. comp. W. e)c: -tru_xw/sw, -etru_/xwsa, tetru_/xwmai, e)tru_xw/qhn Hippocr. Also tru_/xw: tru/cw (147 c) Hom.; and tru/w: tru_/sw Aesch., te/tru_mai, a)/-tru_tos poetic and Ion. (Attic) LSJ
trw=gw (trwg-, trag-) gnaw: trw/comai (806), 2 aor. e)/tragon, dia-te/trwgmai, trwkto/s, kat-e/trwca Hippocr. (Attic) LSJ

tu-g-x-a/nw (teux-, tux-, tuxe-) hit, happen, obtain: teu/comai (806), 2 aor. e)/tuxon, tetu/xhka. Epic also e)tu/xhsa, 2 perf. te/teuxa Ion. (the same form as from teu/xw). te/tugmai and e)tu/xqhn (from teu/xw) often have almost the sense of tetu/xhka and e)/tuxon. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

tu/p-tw (tup-, tupte-) strike: tupth/sw, tupthte/os; other tenses supplied: aor. e)pa/taca or e)/paisa, perf. pe/plhga, pe/plhgmai, aor. pass. e)plh/ghn. e)/tuya Epic, Ion. and Lyric, e)tu/pthsa Aristotle, 2 aor. e)/tupon poetic, te/tummai poetic and Ion., 2 aor. pass. e)tu/phn poetic, fut. mid. as pass. tupth/somai, or 2 fut. pass. tuph/somai, Aristoph. Nub. 1379. (II.) (Attic) LSJ
tu_/fw (tu_f-, tuf-, for qu_f-, quf-, 125 g) raise smoke, smoke: te/qu_mmai, 2 aor. pass. as intrans. e)p-etu/fhn, e)k-tufh/somai Com. (Attic) LSJ
twqa/zw taunt: twqa/somai (806), e)tw/qasa. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with u
div2.p: u(giai/nw (u(gian-) am in health, recover health: u(gianw=, u_(gi/a_na, u_(gia/nqhn Hippocr. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
u(p-isx-ne/omai (i)sx-, a by-form of e)x-; sx-, sxe-) promise: u(po-sxh/somai, 2 aor. u(p-esxo/mhn, u(p-e/sxhmai. Ion. and poetic usu. u(p-i/sxomai. Cp. e)/xw and i)/sxw. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ
u(fai/nw (u(fan-) weave: u(fanw=, u_(/fhna, u_(/fasmai (489 h), u_(fa/nqhn, u(fanto/s. Hom. also u(fa/w. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
u_(/w rain: u_(/sw, u(=sa Pind., Hdt., Aristotle, e)f-u=smai (489 c), u_(/sqhn Hdt., u_(/somai as pass. (808) Hdt. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with f
div2.p: faei/nw (faen-) appear, show: aor. pass. e)faa/nqhn (W. aa for ae, 643) appeared. Epic. (III.) LSJ

fai/nw (fan-) show: fanw=, e)/fhna, perf. pe/fagka (rare in good Att.) have shown, 2 perf. pe/fhna have appeared, pe/fasmai (489 h), e)fa/nqhn (rare in prose) was shown, 2 aor. pass. e)fa/nhn as intrans. appeared, 2 fut. pass. fanh/somai shall appear; fut. mid. fanou=mai shall show and shall appear. On the trans. and intrans. use see 819; for the inflection of certain tenses see 401 ff. Hom. has 2 aor. iter. fa/neske appeared, v. a. a)/-fantos; and, from root fa-: fa/e appeared and fut. perf. pefh/setai shall appear. Connected forms pi-fau/skw, faei/nw, fanta/zomai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
fa/-skw (fa-) say: only pres. and imperf.: see fhmi/. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
fei/domai (feid-, fid-) spare: fei/somai, e)feisa/mhn, feiste/os. Epic 2 aor. mid. redupl. pefido/mhn (448 D.). Epic fut. pefidh/somai (fide-). (Attic) LSJ

fen-, fn-, fa- (for f&nnull;-, 35 b) kill: 2 aor. e)/pefnon and pe/fnon (part. kata-pefnw/n, also accented -pe/fnwn), perf. mid. pe/famai, fut. perf. pefh/somai. Epic. Cp fo/nos murder and qei/nw (qen-) smite. LSJ

fe/rw (fer-, oi)-, e)nek-, e)negk- for e)n-enek, 529) bear, carry: fut. oi)/sw, 1 aor. h)/negka,
2 aor. h)/negkon, 2 perf. e)nh/noxa, perf. mid. e)nh/negmai (3 s. -gktai inscr.), aor. pass. h)ne/xqhn also intrans., fut. pass. kat-enexqh/somai and oi)sqh/somai, v. a. oi)sto/s, -te/os. Other Att. forms are: oi)/somai fut. mid. and pass. (809), h)negka/mhn 1 aor. mid., h)negko/mhn 2 aor. mid. (rare: S. O. C. 470). Poetic and dial. forms are: 2 pl. pres. imper. fe/rte (for fe/rete) Epic, 1 aor. imper. oi)=se for oi)=son Epic (and Aristoph.), 1 aor. inf. a)n-oi=sai or a)n-w=|sai (once in Hdt.), fut. inf. oi)/sein Pind., oi)se/men (ai) Hom., 1 aor. h)/neika, -a/mhn Hom., Hdt., h)/nika Aeol., Dor., etc., 2 aor. h)/neikon rare in Hom., perf. mid. e)nh/neigmai Hdt., aor. pass. h)nei/xqhn Hdt., v. a. ferto/s Hom., Eur., a)n-w/istos Hdt. (a)/noistos?). (VI.) (Attic) LSJ

feu/gw (feug-, fug-) flee: feu/comai 806 (feucou=mai, 540, rare in prose), 2 aor. e)/fugon, 2 perf. pe/feuga, feukto/s, -te/os. Hom. has perf. act. part. pefuzo/tes as if from a verb fu/zw (cp. fu/za flight), perf. mid. part. pefugme/nos, v. a. fukto/s. By-form fug-ga/nw, New Ion. and Att. poetry, in comp. in prose. (Attic) LSJ
fh-mi/ (fh-, fa-) say, inflected 783: fh/sw, e)/fhsa, fato/s, -te/os. Poetical and dial. forms 783 D. ff. (Attic) LSJ
fqa/-nw (fqh-, fqa-) anticipate: fqh/somai (806), e)/fqasa, 2 aor. e)/fqhn (like e)/sthn). Fut. fqa/sw doubtful in Att., 2 aor. mid. part. fqa/menos Epic. Hom. fqa_/nw = *fqa/nvw. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

fqei/rw (fqer-, fqor-, fqar-) corrupt: fqerw=, e)/fqeira, e)/fqarka, but usu. 2 perf. di-e/fqora am ruined (have corrupted in Att. poetry), e)/fqarmai, 2 aor. pass. e)fqa/rhn, dia-fqarh/somai, fqarto/s Aristotle. Fut. dia-fqe/rsw N 625, diafqere/w Hdt. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

fqi/nw (fqi-) waste, perish, mostly poetical and usu. intrans., Epic fqi_/nw (= fqinvw): fut. fqi/sw poetic (Hom. fqi_/sw) trans., aor. e)/fqisa poetic (Hom. e)/fqi_sa) trans., 2 aor. mid. athematic e)fqi/mhn perished poetic (fqi/wmai, fqi_/mhn for fqi-i_mhn, fqi/sqw, fqi/sqai, fqi/menos), e)/fqimai poetic (plup. 3 pl. e)fqi/ato), e)fqi/qhn Hom., fqito/s Tragic. The form fqi/w in Hom. is assumed on the basis of fqi/h|s and e)/fqien, for which fqi/eai, e)/fqito (or e)/sqien) have been conjectured. Hom. fqi_/sw, e)/fqi_sa are also read fqei/sw, etc. Byform fqinu/qw. (IV.) LSJ
file/w love: regular (cp. 385); fut. mid. filh/somai may be pass. (808). Hom. has filh/menai pres. inf. and e)fi_la/mhn (fil-) aor. mid. Aeolic fi/lhmi. (Attic) LSJ
fla/w bruise (cp. qla/w): flassw=, for fla/sw, Theocr., e)/fla (s) sa, pe/flasmai (489 c) and e)fla/sqhn Hippocr. fla/w eat greedily, swallow: only pres. and imperf., and only in Comedy. LSJ
fle/gw burn, trans. and intrans: e)c-e/fleca Aristoph., kat-efle/xqhn, a)/-flektos Eur. Very rare in prose. By-form flege/qw poetic. (Attic) LSJ
fra/g-nu_mi (frag-) and fa/rgnu_mi fence, mid. fra/gnumai; only in pres. and imperf. Cp. fra/ttw. (IV.) (Attic) LSJ

fra/zw (frad-) tell, point out, declare, mid. consider, devise: fra/sw, e)/frasa, pe/fraka, pe/frasmai rarely mid., e)fra/sqhn as mid., fraste/os. Epic 2 aor. (e)) pe/fradon 448 D. (part. pefradme/nos). Mid. fut. fra/s (s) omai Epic, e)fras (s) a/mhn poetic and Ion. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

fra/ttw (frag-) fence: e)/fraca (and e)/farca Att. inscr.), pe/fragmai and pe/fargmai, e)fra/xqhn, a)/-fraktos. The forms with ar for ra are common and are Old Att. See fra/gnu_mi. (III.)
(Attic) LSJ
fri_/ttw (fri_k-) shudder: e)/frica (147 c), pe/fri_ka am in a shudder (part. pefri_/kontas Pind.). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
fru_/gw (frug-, fru_g-) roast: e)/fruca (147 c), pe/fru_gmai, fru_kto/s, 2 aor. pass. e)fru/ghn Hippocr. (Attic) LSJ
fula/ttw (fulak-) guard: fula/cw, e)fu/laca, 2 perf. pefu/laxa, pefu/lagmai am on my guard, e)fula/xqhn, fulakte/os. Fut. mid. fula/comai also as pass. in Soph. (808). (III.) (Attic) LSJ
fu_/rw (fur-) mix, knead: e)/fursa Hom., pe/furmai, e)fu/rqhn Aesch., fut. perf. pefu/rsomai Pind., su/m-furtos Eur. fu_ra/w mix is regular. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

fu_/w (fu-, fu_-; Hom. fu^/w, rare in Att.) produce: fu_/sw, e)/fu_sa, 2 aor. e)/fu_n grew, was (687), pe/fu_ka am by nature, am (693), futo/n plant. 2 aor. pass. e)fu/hn late (doubtful in Att.). 2 perf. Epic forms: pefu/a_si, e)m-pefu/h| Theognis, pefuw/s, e)m-pefuui=a; 1 plup. with thematic vowel e)pe/fu_kon Hesiod. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with x
div2.p: xa/zw (xad-) force back, usu. xa/zomai give way. Pres. act. in prose only a)na-xa/zw Xen., xa/ssomai, a)n-e/xassa Pind., di-exasa/mhn Xen. See also kad-. Poetic, chiefly Epic. (III.) LSJ

xai/rw (xar-, xare-, xaire-) rejoice: xairh/sw, kexa/rhka, kexa/rhmai and ke/xarmai Att. poetry, 2 aor. pass. e)xa/rhn intrans. rejoiced, xarto/s. Hom. has 2 perf. act. part. kexarhw/s, 1 aor. mid. xhra/mhn, 2 aor. mid. kexaro/mhn, fut. perf. kexarh/sw and kexarh/somai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
xala/w loosen: e)xa/lasa, e)xala/sqhn (489 e). Fut. xala/sw Hippocr., aor. e)xa/laca Pind., perf. kexa/laka Hippocr. (Attic) LSJ
xalepai/nw (xalepan-) am offended: xalepanw=, e)xale/phna, e)xalepa/nqhn. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

xa-n-d-a/nw (xend-, xond-, xad- for x&nnull;d-, 35 b) contain: xei/somai for xendsetai, 2 aor. e)/xadon, 2 perf. ke/xanda as pres. (ke/xonda? cp. v. 1. *w 192). Poetic (mostly Epic) and Ion. (IV.) LSJ
xa/skw (xhn-, xan-; xa/skw for x&nnull;-skw? 35 b) gape: e)g-xanou=mai (806), 2 aor. e)/xanon, 2 perf. ke/xhna am agape (698). Ion., Epic, and in Aristoph. (V.) (Attic) LSJ
xe/zw (xed-, xod-), = Lat. caco: xesou=mai (540, 806), rarely xe/somai, e)/xesa, 2 aor. e)/xeson rare, 2 perf. ke/xoda, ke/xesmai. (III.) (Attic) LSJ

xe/w (xeu-, xev-, xu-) pour; on the contraction see 397. In prose usu. in comp. (e)c, e)n, kata/, su/n, etc.): fut. xe/w (541, 1881), aor. e)/xea (543 a), ke/xuka, ke/xumai, e)xu/qhn, xuqh/somai, xuto/s. Mid. xe/omai pres. and fut., e)xea/mhn aor. Epic forms: pres. (rarely) xei/w (Aeolic xeu/w), fut. xeu/w (?) b 222, aor. also e)/xeua (543 a), 1 aor. mid. e)xeua/mhn = Att. e)xea/mhn, 2 aor. mid. athematic e)xu/mhn as pass. (Attic) LSJ
xlad- in 2 perf. part. kexla_dw/s swelling, pl. kexla_/dontas, inf. kexla_/dein. Pind. LSJ
xo/w (= xovw) heap up: xw/sw, e)/xwsa, a)na-ke/xwka, ke/xwsmai, e)xw/sqhn, xwsqh/somai, xwsto/s. Cp. 489 a, c. (Attic) LSJ
xraisme/w (xraisme-, xraism-) profit, pres. late: xraismh/sw, e)xrai/smhsa, 2 aor. e)/xraismon. Hom. LSJ

*xra/omai (xrw=mai) use (xra-, xrh-): pres. xrh=|, xrh=tai, etc. 395, xrh/somai, e)xrhsa/mhn, ke/xrhmai have in use (poetic also have necessary), e)xrh/sqhn (489 e), xrhsto/s good, xrhste/os. Hdt. has xra=tai, 3 pl. xre/wntai (from xrh/ontai), subj. xre/wmai, imper. xre/w, inf. xra=sqai (Ion. inscr. xrh=sqai), part. xrew/menos. Cp. 641 D. Fut. perf. kexrh/somai Theocr. (Attic) LSJ

*ast;xra/w (xrw=) utter an oracle (xra-, xrh-): pres. xrh=|s, xrh=|, 394 (sometimes in
the meaning of xrh/|zeis, xrh/|zei), xrh/sw, e)/xrhsa, ke/xrhka, ke/xrhsmai Hdt., e)xrh/sqhn (489 e). Mid. xra/omai (xrw=mai) consult an oracle' xrh/somai Ion., e)xrhsa/mhn Hdt. Cp. xrh/|zw. 522 b, 641 D. Hdt. has xre/wn. (Attic) LSJ
xrh/ it is necessary, a)po/-xrh it suffices: see 793. (Attic) LSJ
xrh/|zw want, ask, Att. chiefly pres. and imperf.: xrh/|sw. Epic and Ion. xrhi+/zw (later xrei+/zw): xrhi+/sw, e)xrh/i+sa. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
xri_/w (xri_- for xri_s-) anoint, sting: xri_/sw, e)/xri_sa, ke/xri_mai (and ke/xri_smai?) 489 b), e)xri_/sqhn (489 e) Tragic, xri_sto/s Tragic. (Attic) LSJ
xrw/|zw (for xrw-i/zw; cp. xrw/-s complexion) colour, stain: ke/xrwsmai (489 c; (better ke/xrw|smai?), e)xrw/sqhn (e)xrw/|sqhn?). Poetic xroi+/zw. 512. (III.) (Attic) LSJ
xwre/w give place, go: regular. Fut. xwrh/sw and xwrh/somai 806 a. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with y
div2.p: *ya/w (yw=) rub (ya-, yh-): pres. yh=|s, yh=|, etc., 394; a)po-yh/sw, e)/yhsa, perf. kat-e/yhgmai from the by-form yh/xw. (Attic) LSJ
ye/gw blame: ye/cw, e)/yeca, e)/yegmai Hippocr., yekto/s. (Attic) LSJ
yeu/dw deceive, mid. lie: yeu/sw, e)/yeusa, e)/yeusmai usu. have deceived or lied, but also have been deceived, e)yeu/sqhn, yeusqh/somai. (Attic) LSJ
yu_/xw (yux-, yu_x-) cool: yu/cw (147 c), e)/yuca, e)/yu_gmai, e)yu_/xqhn, yu_xqh/somai (?) Hippocr., 2 aor. pass. a)p-eyu/xhn as intrans. cooled, yu_kte/os Hippocr. (Attic) LSJ

div2.head: Verbs beginning with w
div2.p: w)qe/w (w)q- for vwq-, w)qe-, 485 a) push: imperf. e)w/qoun (431), w)/sw, e)/wsa (431), e)/wsmai (443), e)w/sqhn, w)sqh/somai. Fut. w)qh/sw only in Att. poetry, aor. w)=sa and perf. w)=smai Ion., a)p-wsto/s Ion., poetic, a)p-wste/os poetic. (Attic) LSJ

w)ne/omai (vwne-; cp. Lat. ve-num) buy: imperf. e)wnou/mhn (431), w)nh/somai, e)w/nhmai (443) have bought or been bought, e)wnh/qhn was bought, w)nhto/s, -te/os. For e)wnhsa/mhn (late), Att. has e)pria/mhn (p. 138). Imperf. w)neo/mhn Hdt., w)nou/mhn Att. in comp. (a)nti/, e)c). (VI.)
(Attic) LSJ
